story:
/// OUR STORY \\\

Fiona O'Leary Sloan founded IARA (pronounced yiah-rah) in Detroit, Michigan in the summer of 2014 -- and is now hoping to take it full-time. Fiona lived in Rio de Janeiro in her early twenties and was inspired by the bright colors and fluid femininity of Rio's samba, surf, and conflicted heritage. Combining this inspiration with the beadweaving techniques traditionally employed by Native American artists in her home state of New Mexico, Fiona founded IARA in 2014 to unite these passions into beautiful, wearable artwork. She believes that everyone should own at least one handmade item, and seeks to make that dream a possibility through her artwork.

Where does the name IARA come from? The iara is a figure of Brazilian (specifically Tupi and Guaraní) mythology. The word, meaning "lady of the lake" or "water queen," derives from the Old Tupiyîara: y (water) + îara (lady). When portrayed in other cultures, the iara is usually represented as a siren, water nymph, or mermaid.


/// OUR JEWELRY \\\

Fiona, the founder and maker at IARA, makes each piece of jewelry by hand in her Detroit studio (read: her living room). All pieces are designed and handwoven in Detroit, Michigan using the finest quality materials. Each piece is inspired by, and named after, a place in the world that Fiona has either visited or wants to visit. No two pieces are alike. There is a limited quantity of each perk available, so contribute quickly to secure your item!










/// OUR GOALS \\\

I am hoping to raise at least $1,500 through this campaign, which is the amount of money I have spent thus far on materials & supplies to start this business. By raising this money, I will be able to transition IARA into a revenue-positive small business and spread the word about my jewelry on a larger scale. But you won't be giving money away for no reason - you'll be receiving a handmade jewelry item whenever you contribute to my campaign!

If I do not meet my goal of $1,500, I will use any money I did raise to purchase additional materials to scale my business and fund basic marketing practices (i.e., production of business cards, website maintenance, etc.). 


/// HELP IARA FOR FREE \\\

If money is tight and you aren't able to make a monetary contribution, fear not! You can help IARA immensely just by sharing this page with your friends using the share tools on this page. Let's get the word out and make some noise about IARA!

“I try to curate designs that represent the whole community with a focus on high quality products and diversity. I try to make this space an experience."

                                                      -Alanna Rayford, owner of Urban Stitch Boutique

The Birth of  Urban Stitch Boutique

Urban Stitch Boutique began as a pop-up "shopping social" in clubs around the San Francisco. First called, "Bread and Butter, " it hosted over 40 vendors and incorporated djs and drink specials. The event was curated to fit the young, hip Bay Area audience attending and harnessed a large following of fashion-forward people looking to support local designers and artisans.  These successes, led owner Alanna Rayford to make these pop-up fashion events into a brick and mortar business across the bay in Downtown Oakland. 

In October of 2013, owner Alanna Rayford opened her doors to the public, with the aspiration of helping to launch the collections of talented designers, whose stories have not yet been told, while giving shoppers the thrill of the possibility of owning a "Versace before it was a Versace."


Urban Stitch Boutique: A Fashion Resource For The Community

"Urban Stitch is necessary for this community because it is a hub. It’s a place for people to come, showcase their work, gain visibility, and meet other people who do the same thing. It creates a sense of community where we can all build a movement in Oakland, and perpetuate the arts.” - Stephanie Madrinan, 31rax, featured at U.S.B.

Urban Stitch Boutique is a platform for showcasing contemporary designers, specialty lifestyle brands, and home accessories. Our boutique functions as a resource for shoppers, as well as a hub for designers to share their ideas, gain notoriety and develop their craft.  Urban Stitch is not just a place to purchase, it is a place to gather- hosting events such as fashions shows and book launches to further bring the community together.

We currently carry the work of over 25 local and emerging designers whose work ranges from dresses made with hand-woven fabric from Uganda, to knitwear using only yarn manufactured in the USA. The collection is diverse and unique, speaking to each designer’s craftsmanship and vision. 

We take the time to get to know each of our designers’ stories so that we can pass them along to our customers, creating what we call, a "Curated Shopping Experience."  In doing this, we are creating a deeper connection to the process and the passion the designers have for their craft.  


Supporting Local Oakland Businesses

Urban Stitch, although new, is already a vital part of the Downtown / Uptown district in Oakland. On the route for the ever-popular Oakland Art Murmur, and actively engaged in the neighborhood, we offer an artistic refuge for designers to come and discuss their work, exhibit their pieces, and build community. Urban Stitch is the work of an entrepreneur supporting other entrepreneurs.

Oakland is going through a revival, and we're proud to be a part of that story


The Revitalization of Oakland

Alanna has been in love with Oakland since before she moved here back in 2010.  Having grown up in the Bay Area, she has been no stranger to what people affectionately call,"The Town." She loves the diversity,  the progressiveness,  and the community that exists here and wants to be part of what people are calling the "Revitalization of Oakland." 

Alanna envisions and is actively seeking support in creating a fashion district in the city and is using Urban Stitch Boutique as a tool to make this happen by providing a platform for which she can launch designers and gain notoriety for fashion in Oakland.  She makes a great effort to stay connected with other people in fashion and in retail to make this a collective effort of building Oakland back to economic glory. 

(Oakland mayor Libby Schaaf rocking a great look at Urban Stitch on Plaid Friday, 11/28/14)


What The Money Will Be Used For?

Urban Stitch is located in a beautiful historic building that looks down on the corner of 17th and Broadway on the 2nd floor of 1635 Broadway Street.  The space is beautiful and in a bustling location, but there are several reasons why Urban Stitch needs your help and why we are leveraging Indiegogo for the much-needed improvments in order to accomplish our goals.     

Thanks to a generous offer from the City of Oakland, Urban Stitch has the opportunity to receive a matching grant for façade and interior improvements. But—in order to receive this funding, we have to match their donation by fundraising the same amount on our own. If we can’t raise the money to match their grant by the end of 2014, our opportunity to receive this matching grant from the city of Oakland will be lost.

Unfortunately the repairs and support we need extend far beyond Oakland’s grant. In order to truly build a thriving designer-friendly community space we need to invest in our future, and not just cover our current structural emergencies.

The majority of the funds will be used to repair our physical space. Urban Stitch is located on the second floor of a historical building in Oakland and is in dire need of repairs. New flooring, lighting, and signage are urgently needed.                                 


                                    


 Contribute Towards A Fashion-Forward Community Space Today!

"I'm asking for $25,000 to invest in the growth of a business that supports multiple businesses. I'm asking for $25,000 to contribute to a community that I believe in, and that I want to be a part of for a very long time." - Alanna Rayford, owner Urban Stitch

Donate today and help Urban Stitch get a much-needed upgrade! We urgently need your help to close out the year with this grant. You can help us get there.


Meet Alanna Rayford 

With a degree from the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising (FIDM) and over 12 years as a fashion industry professional, owner and head curator, Alanna Rayford, is no stranger to what makes fashion accessible, interesting, and profitable.Alanna loves being a part of Oakland because of its entrepreneurial energy and the community that shares her vision for a progressive and supportive world.


Designers At Urban Stitch

Isso SF, Harumi K, Nneka, Mixx Collection, Taylor Jay, Sabanoh, Myrrhia Fine Knitwear, Vermeulen & Co, Jeaja, Belle Neptune, Evarize, 31 Rax (Vintage), L’Oven Fresh, Sheila B., Isle of Capricorn, Elizabeth in Pearls, Chains by Lauren, The Contradiction, Rikki West, Crusian Gold, Lucci Charmers, Chani Di Prima, Alicia Zakon

New flooring, lighting, and signage are urgently needed.                                                                      
 Contribute Towards A Fashion-Forward Community Space Today!
"I'm asking for $25,000 to invest in the growth of a business that supports multiple businesses. I'm asking for $25,000 to contribute to a community that I believe in, and that I want to be a part of for a very long time." - Alanna Rayford, owner Urban Stitch

Donate today and help Urban Stitch get a much-needed upgrade! We urgently need your help to close out the year with this grant. You can help us get there.

Meet Alanna Rayford 

With a degree from the Fashion Institute of Design & Merchandising (FIDM) and over 12 years as a fashion industry professional, owner and head curator, Alanna Rayford, is no stranger to what makes fashion accessible, interesting, and profitable.Alanna loves being a part of Oakland because of its entrepreneurial energy and the community that shares her vision for a progressive and supportive world.

Designers At Urban Stitch
Isso SF, Harumi K, Nneka, Mixx Collection, Taylor Jay, Sabanoh, Myrrhia Fine Knitwear, Vermeulen & Co, Jeaja, Belle Neptune, Evarize, 31 Rax (Vintage), L’Oven Fresh, Sheila B., Isle of Capricorn, Elizabeth in Pearls, Chains by Lauren, The Contradiction, Rikki West, Crusian Gold, Lucci Charmers, Chani Di Prima, Alicia Zakon

story:
Additional stretch goals sizes (US) are as follows: 

40C, 42C 

44D, 44DD, 44DDD, 44G, 44H, 44I

46D, 46DD, 46DDD, 46G, 46H, 46I

 

 

 Follow us on Facebook

Join us on Instagram

Tweet us on Twitter

 

Thank you to "Make Lemonade" for providing us with the beautiful space during the video shoot!

For PRESS INQUIRIES please email us at press@houseofanesi.com

Questions about this project? Check out our FAQ page

Risks and challenges

Bringing a product of this level to market is not easy; but thankfully we have established partnerships with some of the world’s most experienced suppliers & manufacturers.

Our promise to you is that we’ll keep you updated throughout the campaign and that these bras are definitely worth the wait! As manufacturing starts, we’ll provide you with behind-the-scenes footage and videos from the initial production run.

Our German and Tunisian manufacturers are eagerly waiting to start production which is scheduled to start 3 weeks after the close of our Kickstarter campaign.

We can guarantee delivery of the first 1000 orders by March 2019. We’ll adjust our delivery estimation in the event of greater demand.

We’ve accounted for delays in our estimated delivery time of March 2019, but should any unexpected challenges arise that could impact the production of the Anesi Bra, you’ll be the first to know. Our team will be working 24/7 and will do everything in our power to ensure our backers are more than satisfied.

If you are unsatisfied with your Anesi Bra and wish for an exchange, please let us know. We will happily exchange the bra for a different size. (US & Canada only). Our team will help you step-by-step to find the perfect size for you.

Thank you for joining us in this journey to help bring 100% of women the support and comfort they deserve!

story:
UPDATE:

In celebration of already being over 40% funded, we are introducing a Referral Contest!  Check out the details below to win a Thicket:


About Us

We are musicians that are passionate about building the instruments other musicians want to play.

  • I've toured in bands, worked in sessions for other companies and artists, and have played almost every guitar brand under the Sun.  Balaguer Guitars is an amalgamation of my experiences as a musician but also as a person.  I love vintage guitars, but I also dig modern design and innovation.  You will see a fusion of these two aspects in my designs.
  • This campaign is very important to me because I know that these guitars can & will affect someone in a positive way.  The creative juices begin to flow and you feel inspired.  The fact that something I have designed & built can make someone feel that way is enough reason for me to pursue this full-time.
  • Your contributions will not only make a difference here at Balaguer Guitars, but you will also affect every musician who is able to get their hands on one of our guitars.  YOU are making Balaguer Guitars a reality, and that's pretty cool.
  • Check out all of the Balaguer Models here: Balaguer Guitars | Models
- Joe Balaguer (Owner/Founder of Balaguer Guitars)

What We Need & What You Get

  • $10,000 will help stock our shop in Pennsylvania with more tools and machines, which will expedite the Quality Control process before the guitars are shipped to YOU.  It will also raise our in-stock level of production series guitars from the factory we use.
  • Our models are drafted in a computer-aided program and are then cut out on a CNC machine.  This machine is more accurate than any human, and will offer consistent cuts each time.  After routing the wood, all work is finished by hand. This is the case for both the Production Series as well as the USA Custom Shop guitars.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the funds to put towards increasing our in-stock Production Series guitars.
  • Check out the perks below:


The Impact

Our campaign is focused on funding the Balaguer Guitars shop space, and raising our production level.  Each contribution will help put our guitars in peoples' hands.

  • You will be promoting art, creativity, music, and a small family business.
  • Having established relationships with wood, hardware, case, and other manufacturers allows us to ensure the highest quality components are used for our guitars.

Risks & Challenges

With any small business, there are risks & challenges to keep in mind

  • If we were to rise above our initial goal, there could be a challenge of re-working our production timeline so we can meet the demand.  This would be resolved by gaining additional helpers in the shop and pushing the timeline back by a month.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can get the word out by sharing our campaign via the Indiegogo share tools, or by copying & pasting the link in your URL bar.

Balaguer Merch

Balaguer Guitars T-Shirt (Front & Back)


Balaguer Guitars Exclusive T-Shirt (Front & Back)


Hemlock Pickups T-Shirt (Front & Back)


Balaguer Guitars Pullover Hoodie (Front & Back)


Balaguer Guitars Artists
Beau Burchell of Saosin rocks a USA Custom Shop Thicket


Keith Gibbons of Modern Suits rocking a Grace



Frequently Asked Questions


  • I have a question.  How can I reach someone at Balaguer Guitars? 
Shoot us an email via our Contact form.  We will get back to you ASAP!

  • I live in (enter country outside of the USA here), how much will shipping cost me?
Please send us a private message on here, or you can reach out via our Contact form on our website for a shipping quote.

  • What is the estimated wait or delivery timeline on a Balaguer Guitar?
Production Series guitars pre-ordered during this Indiegogo Campaign have an estimated delivery of December 2015.  USA Custom Shop guitars are usually between 4-6 months, but it will vary depending on specifications.  Please feel free to Contact  us for a definitive timeline.

  • How do I tell you what shirt size I am?
Please contact us directly via Indiegogo or you can email us via the Contact form on our website.

Balaguer Guitar Models

story:
• Classic and customizable: You can choose from our ‘Classic’ colors, or go with a ‘Custom’ pair to design your shoe inside and out! There are endless options so you can create a unique pair to match your style.
  • Empowering women and children: Each pair of shoes is hand-made by entrepreneurial Kenyan women, our Maker Mums. We pay above-market wages, and 100% of net income supports life-changing care for children with special needs in Kenya.
  • Responsibly sourced: We develop long-term partnerships with our suppliers so we can ensure our entire supply chain is socially and environmentally responsible. 

The espadrille is a timeless shoe style. It's versatile, casual, and comfortable, and our Classic Afridrilles add a couple key improvements: super-soft leather insoles and a dash of African flair in the interior lining. 

We offer our Classics at a discounted price in our four most popular colors: black, natural, safari green, and gray. 

Available Colors for the Classic Afridrille

We think the Classics are gorgeous, but we wanted a challenge: Could we make this shoe fully customizable, a perfect reflection of each customer's individual style? 

Nothing about our Custom Afridrille is “off the rack”. Each customer creates their own unique shoe by selecting from: 

  • 10 colors of the canvas
  • 13 silk-screened print designs (or plain!)
  • 12 colors of ink for the print 
  • 12 inner linings in Kenyan kanga prints

For a small taste of what combinations are available, check out our lookbook!

We’ve partnered with our friends at Zazzle to bring some beautiful technology to the Afridrille design process. Using their interactive software, you can see exactly what your shoe will look like as you select from an wide variety of options. 

The Afridrille Designer on Desktop

 

The Afridrille Designer on Mobile

 

Zazzle is providing us with the use of their proprietary design software at no cost during the Kickstarter so you can see exactly what your shoes will look like as you design them. Customers will receive a link to design their shoes on the Zazzle platform at the end of the campaign.  

'Ubuntu' is a South African philosophy that speaks to the reality that we are all connected and interdependent.   

Positive economic and social impact is what sets the Afridrille apart from other purpose-driven shoes. Each pair of Afridrilles is hand-sewn by our Maker Mums in Maai Mahiu, Kenya. These are entrepreneurial women who directly benefit from every pair of shoes sold, because they’re the ones making them! And 100% of what we make from our products goes to support life-changing healthcare and therapy for children with special needs. 

All our Mums earn above-market wages, have health insurance (almost never provided by the private sector here), and are able to send their children to school. None of our Maker Mums were homeowners when they started working with us, and now today half own their own homes. Every single Mum takes a huge amount of pride in her work and her empowered role in the community  

Why do we call these women our “Maker Mums?” Because the majority of the women in the Ubuntu Sewing Studio have children enrolled in the Ubuntu Special Needs Centre, where we provide healthcare and education for children living with a variety of special needs, including Down syndrome, autism, and cerebral palsy. 

Every single cent of our net income supports life-changing care for children with special needs through our Special Needs Centre and medical camps.

Buying an Afridrille isn’t just a transaction, it's a connection to these Mums and their children and supports a transformation in their lives.

Every step of our supply chain represents a positive economic benefit to each person who helps make the Afridrille.  

Our suppliers are long-term partners who provide meaningful jobs and have excellent standards of employment. All our Custom Afridrilles are silk-screened by hand at our partner Color Creations, for example. We source our leather insoles from a local boutique tannery, and our blue-and-orange tags are hand-beaded by Maasai craftswomen. 

Now it's time to have fun! Browse the rewards below and then select from the right-hand side of the page, which also contains more detailed information about the perks you’ll receive from backing our campaign! 

Here is a look at our other Ubuntu Made products that are in the rewards packages: 

    

We’ve sourced top-quality materials for the Afridrille, in order to make a shoe that will be comfortable all day long, and can last for years. 

  • Canvas: Heavyweight 15-oz plain weave canvas 
  • Tag: Leather tag beaded by hand by Maasai artisans
  • Print: Silk-screened by hand using water-based, non-toxic inks
  • Leather: 100% Kenyan nubuck pull-up leather, cut by hand 
  • Sole: Traditional Spanish jute rope sole lined with vulcanized rubber for durability 

Backers can choose from almost unlimited design options! Colors and patterns are subject to change over the course of the campaign (we'll keep you informed if we do!), but our current offering includes:

  • 10 Canvas colors
  • 13 silk-screened patterns, or choose no pattern at all!
  • 12 ink colors available
  • 12 kanga patterns for the lining


The Afridrille is available in standard US mens' and womens' sizes. The fit of our shoes is true-to-size and intentionally snug at first. Within a few hours, they’ll conform to your feet.

Since we can not offer returns on customized Afridrilles, we encourage you to measure your feet at home to be 100% sure! 

Here’s what you’ll need:  

  • A ruler or tape measure  
  • Masking tape or a pencil  
  • A door or flat section of wall with flat baseboards 

How to measure your feet:

  • Barefoot, stand straight with your heel against the wall or door. Do this in the evening, or the afternoon at least, once you’ve been on your feet for a while. Who wants to measure feet in the morning anyway?
  • Mark the end of your foot by placing a piece of masking tape or a pencil on the floor parallel to the wall, flush with the tip of your furthest toe.
  • Stand back up straight and check again. Is your marker right on? As your carpenter would say, measure twice and cut once. (Please do not make any cuts in this process.) Adjust the tape if necessary. 
  • This is exhausting, and you deserve a break. Step away from the wall. Be careful not to disturb the tape/pencil marking the length of your foot.
  • Measure the distance from the wall/door to the tape/pencil.
  • Repeat with your other foot, since most folks have feet with slightly different lengths. This probably goes without saying, but if your feet are different sizes, you should buy for your larger foot.
  • Look up your shoe size in the tables below. If you’re between sizes, round up to the next one

After this Kickstarter campaign ends, we’ll send you an easy survey to fill out, and will also include a link to the Afridrille Designer if you ordered any ‘Custom’ pairs to design your shoes on the Zazzle platform! We plan to go into production by mid-May at the latest, and should deliver shoes to your door in time for the peak summer season.  

 

Hurry up and back this campaign earlier rather than later, as shoes will be produced in the order that they are submitted!

Classic Afridrille in Black

 

Custom Afridrille with white checkerboard on black canvas

 

Custom Afridrille with grey cactus on black canvas

 

Custom Afridrille with white hearts on red canvas

 

Custom Afridrille with white ikat on natural canvas

 

Custom Afridrille with black herringbone on grey canvas

 

Classic Afridrilles in white and safari

 

     

Impact begins with community! We would love your help by introducing our campaign to your own community and spreading the word across your social networks. Click any or all of the banners below to share this campaign, and thank you so much for your support!

Share with your friends on Facebook!

click the banner to share with your friends on Facebook

 

 Give a little tweet love! 

click the banner to share on twitter

 

 Follow us on Instagram! 

click the banner to follow us on Instagram

If you have any other questions or want to dig deeper into the Ubuntu story, please visit the FAQ!  

 

Risks and Challenges:

We're fortunate to be in advanced stages of design and prototyping, which means we've already learned a lot about the materials and fit of our shoe. However, our design and operations teams have encountered several risks in this project, and we're working hard to minimize them.

The first set of risks are operational. With over 20,000 distinct designs, production requires strict processes to communicate production requirements, produce orders exactly as requested, and check quality at multiple points throughout the process.

A second risk is controlling the build quality. Since these are made by hand and a first-of-its-kind product in Kenya, we can mitigate this risk by investing early in rigorous training programs for our Mums, defining consistent step-by-step processes, and ensuring we have multi-point quality control throughout the process to identify any issues early.

Third, we are currently launching extensive real-world and laboratory wear-testing of our shoes to make sure that none of the materials have hidden defects that only reveal themselves in time. We will have the results from these tests before we need to start production of the Afridrille.

story:
The Slip Shirt is now Exclusively available on our website:

GET ONE NOW - CLICK HERE

Slip on, Slip off. No problem.

The name Slip Shirt comes from the fact that you can Slip it on and off with ease, something no other button-up can do. (The top 2 buttons are undo-able the rest are permanent).

Order now to get the Slip Shirt v3.2 and we will send your shirt/s out.

Our backers (that means you) will also have first access and exclusive discounts to our future runs, including voting rights on new colourways and styles.

 

With Luxury Stylings and Fitness Function, the Slip Shirt v3.2 is the best shirt ever. Fabric that doesn't wrinkle, buttons that don't pull or even need to be buttoned, water wicking, long length and brilliant colour --- there's nothing better.

Fitness wear in disguise; enjoy the great feel and function of fitness wear all the time, the Slip Shirt is the worlds only Luxury Fitness Wear. Plus the lightweight skin-tight fit of the Slip Shirt feels incredible to wear, it feels like you're wearing nothing at all!

 

Currently the Slip Shirt v3.2 is only available in the BLAK Short Sleeve type. We will release more colourways & styles in the near future, but don't feel limited, as Henry Ford said:

New potential colourways are outlined below, these will be available to vote on and purchase soon. New potential styles include both Long Sleeve and Sleeveless variants. 

 

Available exclusively on Indiegogo we have the BLAK Short Sleeve Slip Shirt v3.2 in any size you like.

Featuring Black so Dark light barely escapes it, the BLAK Short Sleeve Slip Shirt is the Ultimate in Boss Wear.  

With a commanding Black on Black colourway, the BLAK Slip Shirt elevates you to a powerful position, keeping you the cut above the rest.

Shipping Costs: $10 Australia, $15 International. Free shipping on all purchases over $100 AUD.

You will recieve automatic email updates from Australia Post with tracking info.

 

The Slip Shirt is designed to fit super tight, just get your regular size and we'll do the rest.  

If however you don't want a skin tight fit opt for a size up instead.

The sizes at the top (S, M, L, XL, XXL) are our sizes. The values below are all in centimeters and indicate the size range they'll fit.  

NOTE: The neck fit is only important if you want to wear the top button done up. The arm size is just an indication for the largest size bicep it will fit around (the arm and neck don't stretch).

The top two buttons are undo-able like regular buttons. The rest are permanently done for you.

 

We have worked to ensure our Slip Shirt is ethically manufactured, ensuring the best result for everybody. This is how fashion should be, this is the future.

We produce all our garments using internationally recognised ethical production standards. All of our products are produced in association with renowned Australian Ethical clothing manufacturer OCC Apparel. Continuous inspections are carried out on the manufacturing facility in China by the Globally Accredited Australian Qualspec Organisation.   

Everybody Wins with ethical production:  

The workers: Rather than not paying the workers fairly to cut costs we remove the middlemen instead, ensuring the workers are ethically paid and treated. Better results all round without screwing people over. 

Which leads onto you winning: Any successful business person will tell you that Happy and Positive workers always turn out the best results, meaning your shirt will be finished to a much much higher standard than a non-ethically manufactured one. Additionally cutting middlemen means we are also able to offer our products at the best price, making sure you get fair service too.

Luxury Stylings, Fitness Capability and Everybody Wins? No Question. You are wearing the best button-up ever made.

 

In case for some reason you were unable to tell, the Slip Shirt v3.2 is not a prototype it is already being shipped and worn by many guys around the Globe. We've been selling past versions privately for a few years and decided to open up to a new audience through crowdfunding. Below is a picture of our packages ready for shipping. If you want to see what other backers are saying about the Slip Shirt v3.2 you can check our Kickstarter Campaign page here.

 

From our beginnings with v1.0 to our revolutionary v3.2, here's how the Slip Shirt became what it is.

NOTES: 

v1.0, 1.1 and 2.0 were all only available to exclusive product testers.

v2.1 was initially crowdfunded, which gave us alot of valuable feedback to update our design through v3.0 and 3.1.

You may be wondering why v3.2 isn't called v4.0, well that's because we don't progress to the next full number unless our shirt undergoes massive technological advances in the way it works. The v3.2 does however contain some massive advances on the 3.1: ultra-soft ultra-light feel, immediate water wicking, fast dry, and improved shape retention (improved wrinkle-free). Plus we've managed to create a fabric in the darkest black currently possible in sports knit, with the exception of vantablack. 

v4.0 is currently in the pipeline. It is being developed to feature odour resistent fabric and any improvements to be requested by our new customers (you).

Also in concept development is v5.0 with potential upgrades such as: absolute water resistance whilst still keeping the fabric breathable and electroluminescent fibre inserts.

 

WEBSITE:              gowdafashion.co

INSTAGRAM:     @gowdafashion

FACEBOOK:       @gowdafashion

TWITTER:           @gowdafashion

PINTEREST:       @gowdafashion

CONTACT: sales@gowdafashion.co

our policies

story:
The 1st AND_i+ mens denim collection

 

I am Andreas Eberharter, Designer of the jewelry & accessory label AND_i. We are based in Vienna, Austria.
Beginning of the year I had access to one of the huge denim productions in Europe, it was just an amazing walk through, and I saw so many possibilaties and got that much inspired, so I had to create my own line.

This Spring / Summer Season 2017 AND_i is expanding its range. Now here on indiegogo.com the first AND_i + Men Denim Collection get´s launched.

 

 

You will receive a separate survey email for choosing your favorite DESIGN, COLOR, CUT& SIZE.

 

 

Available in 2 cuts: Skinny Fit and Slim Fit cut
The material is feeling suuuper cosy on the skin, it is 98.5% cotton and 1.5% elastane.

 

You can choose between 7 designs available in blue, grey and black.

Available SIZES:

slim fit: 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 36

skinny fit: 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34

 

So what makes it special? It´s not just another denim line,
The lasered designs are reductions of campaign images of AND_i as well as freely illustrated works by Andreas Eberharter , who is the main designer, founder and owner of the label.

 

 

"Now my customers will be able to purchase a AND_i+ jean with their AND_i belt ," said Eberharter . For a perfectly cohesive look.

 

 

No patterns are attached on the back:

 

 

AND_i belt:

 

This handmade belt has a true jewel as buckle. From wax hand-carved and then cast from brass, the buckle is refined with the precious metal rhodium.

Available SIZES: 80, 85, 90, 95, 100, 105, 110

 

 

About:

 

The participation of AND_i in the Thierry Mugler Men Show in 2009 attracted international attention.

 

The eyepatch that Lady Gaga used in her video „Paparazzi“ soon became a cult object.

 

Meanwhile the jewelry and accessories of AND_i are counted among the must haves of the international fashion scene, stars like Stars wie Milla Jovovich, Kiera Chaplin, Kesha, Kat Graham, Tarkan, Beyonce and Lindsay Lohan are amongst his fans. 

 

see more here: https://www.and-i.com/clippings/

 

 

Customized branded products

Andreas Eberharter has been creating customized branded products for renowned companies like Thierry Mugler, Paco Rabanne, VOGUE, Life Ball, Swarovski, Absolut Vodka, Red Bull and many more for years.

see more customized branded products here: https://www.facebook.com/AndreasEberharterBrand...

 

 

AND_i pieces are seen in many magazines:

 

 

 

 

 

see more here: https://www.and-i.com/clippings/

 

 

Quality: 

AND_i+ jeans are top quality, produced in Europe from high end manufacturer for
international luxury brands.

 

 

 

What you get & what we need:

  • You will receive a jean produced in highest quality and best material with a super cosy feeling.
  • We will need €10.000 to get the collection done.
  • We have awesome perks for you, use the chances.

 

 

Political Correctness

  • As always Andreas Eberharter makes a point of avoiding "political incorrect " low-wage countries for the production of his goods. a production site in Europe was found, which meets all standards and is producing on a very high quality level. This step was necessary in order to guarantee a fair price / performance ratio for the customer. 
 
 

Other ways to support:

  • please help us to publish, spread and share this campaign
  • you may also use the Indiegogo tool

 

more about AND_i: https://www.and-i.com/

story:
GET INVOLVED
I’m in the stage of lifting this concept off the ground. I have several proficient and dedicated collaborators and contacts waiting for me to push the "go" button. We need you to get involved and be a part of this campaign to make it a reality. We need funds to support pre-production, production, first batch and marketing. Check out the perks to pre-order today.

PERKS
Check out the perks and be a part of this campaign.

RETRO FILTER
Unlike common glasses that has a very desaturated look, Retroview's will be equipped with retro filters, that will provide the possibility to catch the colors and tones you want to intensify your everyday life. They are inspired from the 60-70s photo looks. Here are examples of how some of the filters will look.

FRAME
Retroview’s frames will be inspired by classic retro frames from the 60-70s. Here are some concepts of models that will be available.

SIMPLY FOR THE VIEWER
As you heard. Retroview is simple, and simply for the viewer. Which is the owner. The website will be structured to easily create your custom Retroview’s, for both women and men, with help of a live preview creator. First you will choose your frame. Second you will choose your frame color. and for the last step, you will choose your custom filter, how you want to see the world.

PLAN
At the same time the funds will be collected the project will kick off. I will collaborate with my proficient and dedicated collaborators and contacts to make Retroview as exceptional as possible. As an independent designer I can work around the corporate sunglasses market and produce the sunglasses with high quality to a reasonable price. They will be combined with the best of the past and the present.

If the campaign doesn’t reach it’s goal the consequences will be less custom filters and less frame options to start with. And possibly longer time before release.

Take part of the first batch Retroview™ ever. Pre-order now and get involved in this campaign today.

PRE-ORDER
Due to pre-production, production, first batch and marketing costs we need your support. Here’s how you can get involved in this campaign and be the first to wear Retroview's.

1 . Check out the perks on the right hand side and choose either one pair, four pairs at discounted price or one pair, four pairs pre-release Retroview's, including a signed T-shirt for every pair of sunglasses.

2. Continue to the next page and enter your shipping adress followed by your payment details. Note; if you would like to contribute extra over the cost of the perk you have chosen, you can change the figure above here.

3. Complete payment via Paypal or by using your credit/debit card. Retroview will use these funds to make this a reality.

4. We aim to deliver your first pair of Retroview sunglasses before the summer 2015. (Don't worry, you will not need to choose your custom Retroview's yet. You will receive a custom link before the official release where you can customise your Retroview's).


Please contact me if any thoughts about the campaign. 
Enquiries: info@retrovieweyewear.com
Press: press@retrovieweyewear.com

story:
___________________________________________________________

Sorry! The $99 Website Project ended on March 19th 2012.

However, you can still support Kyle through his latest project here on IndieGoGo:

Kyle Berkman - Web Designer

Or contact him directly at his website:

www.kyleberkman.com

___________________________________________________________

Background

Hi! My name is Kyle Berkman and I'm a web developer. I work for a handful of web design companies and also freelance. I'm experienced in HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, & SEO and have an overall great sense of design. I mainly enjoy working with the WordPress platform as it allows the client to maintain their own site with little to no assistance. In terms of limitations, all of the websites above and in the gallery were built on WordPress, so there really are none. The real game breaker is if you can use Facebook then you can use WordPress.

 

The Problem

The work outsourced to me is starting to slow down and I am forced to rely more heavily on freelancing than I have in the past. The problem is that most of the companies that I work for have forced me to sign NDA (non disclosure agreements) which forbid me from claiming hundreds of websites that I have designed or worked on in my freelance portfolio.

 

The Solution

Offer a website deal that is too good to pass up and build up a more complete portfolio in a short amount of time. Starting at $99, you get a fully customized website built on the WordPress platform, all of your initial content added, and even a 1-hour tutoring session showing you how to update and maintain the site on your own, cutting the cost of owning a website down to just yearly hosting fee's (~$50 / year). 

At this point, there is no reason not to have a website for your small business or personal use.

What Can You Do To Help?

If you or anyone you know is in need of a website, give me the chance to wow you and them by pledging for the website perk that applies to you. If you are unsure which one would apply or have any questions, please feel free to contact me at berkman.kyle@gmail.com.

 

Once the fundraising has ended, I will contact you with all the information that you will need to provide and will be available to answer any other questions you may have. If you do not have all the information ready immediately, you don't need to worry. I will be ready to start at your convenience whether it be next week or next month.

 

 

Other Ways To Help?

Aside from helping to spread the word, you can also assist me for much less by making a pledge for smaller designs like business cards, letterhead, or flyers. Although not my primary goal, these designs will also help me fill out my portfolio. If you are interested in something that is not listed, again, please feel free to contact me at berkman.kyle@gmail.com with any questions.

 

More Details On Website Perks.

With all 4 perks, you get a custom design based on your input and suggestions. I can work with as much or as little as you are able to provide. From a visitors standpoint, none of the sites will visually look any better or worse, but just provide different levels of functionality and customization.
      
The classic $99 website: $99 - This is the basic site. It's essentially a place for your visitors to find information and media. It can be quite comprehensive though and has the ability to expand incredibly in functionality, so don't let that fool you.

The e-merchant website: $125 - Same as the above but allows you to sell your products directly to the visitor via an online checkout system. I will add your first 25 items and show you how to add your own in our 1-hour tutoring session.

The custom artwork (or software) website: $150 - This is meant for the designer who has already graphically designed how they want their site to look in Photoshop or a similar program. You would generally provide a layered file that I would then chop up and re-construct into an actual site. Please contact me first regarding your artwork so I can verify it is usable.

*I've modified this perk to include the option of replacing the custom artwork with custom software. (ie: scheduling portal software, etc) Please check with me first so I can verify that the software is compatible with WordPress or that an alternative option is available.*

Custom artwork (or software) e-merchant website: $175 - Same as the above, with the addition of the online checkout system. Again,  I will add your first 25 items and show you how to add your own in our 1-hour tutoring session.

High Resolution Versions Of The Gallery Images

http://i.imgur.com/YvuWI.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/rtfoC.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/SUDa8.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/iU3ip.jpg
http://i.imgur.com/JXIE7.jpg

If you are interested in something that is not listed, again, please feel free to contact me at berkman.kyle@gmail.com with any questions.

With all 4 perks, you get a custom design based on your input and suggestions. I can work with as much or as little as you are able to provide. From a visitors standpoint, none of the sites will visually look any better or worse, but just provide different levels of functionality and customization.      
The classic $99 website: $99 - This is the basic site. It's essentially a place for your visitors to find information and media. It can be quite comprehensive though and has the ability to expand incredibly in functionality, so don't let that fool you. The e-merchant website: $125 - Same as the above but allows you to sell your products directly to the visitor via an online checkout system. I will add your first 25 items and show you how to add your own in our 1-hour tutoring session. The custom artwork (or software) website: $150 - This is meant for the designer who has already graphically designed how they want their site to look in Photoshop or a similar program. You would generally provide a layered file that I would then chop up and re-construct into an actual site. Please contact me first regarding your artwork so I can verify it is usable.


*I've modified this perk to include the option of replacing the custom artwork with custom software. (ie: scheduling portal software, etc) Please check with me first so I can verify that the software is compatible with WordPress or that an alternative option is available.* Custom artwork (or software) e-merchant website: $175 - Same as the above, with the addition of the online checkout system. Again,  I will add your first 25 items and show you how to add your own in our 1-hour tutoring session.



High Resolution Versions Of The Gallery Imageshttp://i.imgur.com/YvuWI.jpghttp://i.imgur.com/rtfoC.jpghttp://i.imgur.com/SUDa8.jpghttp://i.imgur.com/iU3ip.jpghttp://i.imgur.com/JXIE7.jpg

story:
The Old World is a 2D Sandbox RPG in the style of the great old-school NES/SNES games we've come to love, but with a modern twist in terms of game-play.


The game is focused on creating a dynamic gaming experience by featuring an interactive world that is constantly changing; whether due to environmental factors, AI-Controlled empires or various other beings populating each unique, randomly generated world.


Adapting to the enviroment and conditions forced upon the hero by this evolving landscape is key to survival in the dangerous lands of The Old World.


Examples of in-game occurences:


To further explain the kind of mysteries or situations you may find yourself in whilst traversing one of the multitudes of large randomly-generated landscapes, I shall give a few examples.

Imagine two large Empires at War with eachother and you are tasked to infiltrate the other in order to wage havoc and bring it down from the inside. Perhaps you choose to do the polar opposite and actually aid this Empire in the destruction of the Empire that gave you the task.

Perhaps you come across a small town and you hear a rumour that the mayor is corrupt in his fianances with the local bandits. There are a ton of ways to aproach this.

Maybe you approach the mayor as a trade partner offering foreign goods and invite him to a meal on your behalf, maybe he'll accept maybe he won't depends on how you handle the situation.

You could use this moment to get him drunk openely, discuss what he's up to, befriend him, knock him out or drug him.

There are many potential ways of how this could pan out should you choose to drug him, you could take his clothes, go to the bandits and pose as him or an envoy of him and attempt to infilitrate. However maybe he's not actually an accomplice or perhaps he is.


They may attempt to kill you on site, kidnap you, maybe they fall for your deception and believe you are him and slay you on the spot anyway. They may have never seen this person before and passes you along without taking precautions.


Theres a lot to our Sandbox mechanics and we hope to add more in the future. But this is just one way to look at it.

 

 


 

 

Meet the Team

Joxno

Heyo, I am Sebastian "Joxno" Georghiou of Virtual Static and I am the Programmer, Game Designer, Project founder of The Old World and, from time to time, Pixel Artist.
I am 20 years of age and I work on The Old World full-time.


Team Responsibilities

As the Programmer, Game Designer and Project founder my day to day activities range quite far but most of my hours are spent designing new system and also implement them into The Old World.

I also spend a lot of time collaborating with my fellow teammates when it comes to game design ideas but also do a lot of it on my own.

Most of my time is spent solely on developing the game but I also help my teammates to produce content for display.

Past Experience

In terms of Programming Experience, I've been actively writing C++ code for the past 8 or so years but my skills within this area range outside that of just C++. I also have knowledge within Java, VB.NET, PHP, SQL and also a variety of other scripting languages.

I've also made a few smaller games but only as hobby/enjoyment/learning projects which have not been released. I have also been analyzing games and designing game mechanics for the past 3-4 years.

Personal Preference Games

Warcraft 3 (+ The Frozen Throne), Dune 2, Populous, Zelda: ALTTP, Dwarf Fortress, Settlers.

Conclusion

I would like to give a shoutout to all you amazing fans that have followed and supported us throughout a lot of the early development days of The Old World! To all you new and old fans, You're Awesome!

Ironstrom

Hi, I'm Mark "Ironstrom/Ku-Ko" Jackson of Virtual Static.
I'm 21 majoring in Computer Science at University on my up-coming 3rd year and TOW is our project.

 

Team Responsibilities

I'm the member of the team that is renowned for glueing people together. I'm a promoter of team attitudes, casual communication and all-round morale booster.

I influence most aspects of game design planning, world presentation thoughts and environmental design aethetics as a former level designer for the past 10 years; this is my greatest skill/interest.

I also do most of the promotional work related to the game. Most of it involves talking to the fans about the game and re-communicating those thoughts back into the design process. I currently spend much of my time trying to get in contact with indie supporting websites and channels.

Personal Preference Games

My stand out games that I love that'd I'd like to share are Warcraft 3 (+ The Frozen Throne) Grim Fandango, Outcast, Sacrifice and Asheron's Call 2.

Conclusion

I'd like to say thanks to those that have stuck around with us and those new-comers that have come to find us wherever they may have come from, be it word of ear from one of us, your friends or a site and so fourth.

Thanks for visiting and thanks for supporting us to continue not only a dream project of ours but of yours too.

Citizen

My name is Taylor "Citizen" Dickson of Virtual Static, and I’m a 20 year old music student studying at the University of Surrey in Guildford, United Kingdom.

 

Team Responsibilities

Currently the Musical Director and Producer of The Old World, as well as Sound Designer. I joined the project about halfway through the development to the current stage. I am responsible for providing direction for the musical style of The Old World, as well as filling the world with sound effects and creating an immersive, living sonic environment.


Past Experience

Over the number of years I have been writing music, I have composed for a score (pun intended) of different forms of entertainment – ranging from atmospheric minimalist music for documentaries, to heavily stylised electronica reworks of popular musical tunes for British Theatre.
I previously wrote commercial music under the name ‘Red Hare Productions’, however this was pre-University and I have since undergone a complete style overhaul and moved away from that name. Currently I produce under the alias ‘Citizen’, and hoping to release an electronica Glitch-Hop EP before the end of 2012.

Personal Preference Games

Warcraft 3 - The Frozen Throne.

Conclusion

I'm excited to be working on The Old World with such a dedicated team of individuals. This will be the first game score I have done solo, and I am determined to make it one to remember.

TDesius

Hi there, I’m Ryan "TDesius" Chambers of Virtual Static.
I’m 19 years old and I am currently studying Extended Level 3 IT at college and I’m currently on my 2nd year.

 

Team Responsibilities

I was recently introduced to the team of TOW by Mark/Ironstrom, even so I have contributed as much as I could so far towards TOW.

In the future I plan to be helping the team of TOW with the development of TOW and any future games they may create, In order to successfully do this I am currently making sure that everything I learn at college is being practiced and written down.

While I have no real experience with games development yet I am able to quickly adapt to new tasks and am a fast learner. I do however have an in-depth knowledge into the different gameplay types and how they can affect and change different aspects of the game; this is due to the fact that I have essentially been playing games for years. Sure everyone has played games for years; however I have always made sure to widen the genres of the games I decide to play.

Personal Preference Games:

Warcraft 3 (+The Frozen Throne), World of Warcraft

Conclusion:

Thanks to everyone who is reading this, helping to support our cause or overall just following us and getting your friends to join, because as they say “Every bit helps”.

story:
We first want to say THANK YOU for stopping by and checking out our very first Indiegogo campaign!

WE NEED YOUR HELP!
Just a little over two years old, we are an evolving clothing brand looking to make waves in fashion by promoting a SOLID MESSAGE and by GIVING BACK, but we need your help in getting BARNABAS to the next level.

       WHAT WE PLAN ON DOING WITH THE MONEY?

  • We know you want your Barnabas gear as soon as possible, so we are already working with our manufacturing on production. We need the money to get this first batch manufactured and shipped.
  • 10% of raised campaign sales will go directly to The Living Room Intl. helping those impacted and infected with HIV/AIDS in Kenya.
  •  Invest in a sales team to help distribute our brand into retail outlets nationwide & internationally
  •  Allocate funds towards strategic events/tradeshows & marketing/publicity
  •  Invest in setting up the SPRING/SUMMER 2013 collections
  •  And of course,...more 'Mustache Wristbands'

Please join us in making a difference & look fashionable as you do it!

      
 

 
             

Be bold and courageous! Be fearless in making choices that make a difference. Barnabas Clothing Co. was created to challenge people to live their lives with purpose and action, to live A LIFE WORTH IMITATING. So, BARNABAS is more than a brand or a logo; it's an identity and lifestyle. The actual meaning of the name is
"Son of Encouragement," and here at BARNABAS we see our purpose as just that - to be people of encouragement in every aspect of our lives - with what we say, what we do and even with the clothes we wear.

ONE life, ...just ONE life can make an impact! We hope that when you wear our clothes, you take on that challenge - to be a BARNABAS – that you will be bold and courageous and become part of this massive community that is sending ripples of change and hope out into the world.

        
   
   
           

We have partnered with our good friend Juli McGowan Boit, the founder of The Living Room International in Kipkaren, Kenya. The Living Room International is a non-profit organization that provides comprehensive care to those men, women and children living with HIV/AIDS or other life threatening illnesses. Their vision is to be a community that honors life and offers hope and they do so by becoming family to those that are dying. The organization has a 26 bed inpatient hospice facility that allows them to provide compassionate medical, emotional and spiritual support for the patient in their final days of life. The environment and atmosphere is that of a home - everyone is welcome, everyone is loved, and everyone belongs. No one is left to face their pain or fears alone.

          
         

It really does! Some business/brands say they give back to a charity or an organization, but don't tangibly show you in what ways your purchase makes a difference. We look for ways to connect the dots for customers by featuring in each inside label what 10% of your purchase equates to at The Living Room International with our 'BECAUSE OF YOU' quotes.

 		           
                         
                     
               
  • A grandmother in Africa caring for her orphaned grandchildren will receive milk for a week.
  • A mother in Africa, living with AIDS will be able to reach a nearby HIV clinic to receive life-prolonging treatment.
  • A child dying of AIDS in Africa will receive nourishing food and care for a day.
  • An orphaned child in Africa will receive a pair of shoes
              
   














 








 






 

 






 


We need your help in getting the word out about our campaign. We would be so grateful if you would share out our campaign. Please share the Barnabas Clothing Co. story with your family and friends. Follow us and share our story on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram.

1. Buy a some cool Barnabas Clothes!
    With your purchase, you'll be making a real difference in the lives of those in Kenya.

2. Tell your friends about Barnabas Clothing Company!
    Share the link to this site on all your social media platforms. Get involve and make a difference!
   



Is shipping included?
Yes, shipping is included in all perks, except for international orders. If you would like us to ship to you internationally, there will be an additional $25 charge, please add that amount to your contribution at check out. If you forget to add for international shipping we will contact you after the campaign is over.


Will I receive my items before Christmas?
YES!! We are scheduling to produce and ship your items within 2 weeks before gifting for Christmas. We can only guarantee shipping before Christmas to orders only in the USA. No guarantee for international orders.

When will I receive my items?
You will receive your items approximately 2-3 weeks after the end of the project. So, all of those items that you are buying for your family and friends will arrive in plenty of time for Christmas!


What about sizing?
All of our shirts and sweatshirts run true to size for both men and women. If you would like to purchase any of our designs in an XXL, simply add $2 to your contribution amount, and add a note during paypal check out that you'd like an XXL in the design you purchased. XXL is not available in the Women's Raglan Sweatshirt. See SIZING CHARTS in MEDIA GALLERY.


Are there YOUTH SIZES available?
YES! We currently offer youth sizes only in our graphic t-shirts. All other items are specific to adult sizing only. When ordering, make a note in the 'comment' box for youth sizing for graphic t-shirts and we'll confirm it to you by email. For measurements, see sizing charts.

Where can I get more information about The Living Room International?
You can hear some of the amazing stories about what is happening at The Living Room International by visiting http://www.livingroominternational.org/.


What if I have other questions?
If you have any questions about our company, The Living Room International, or our products, you can email us at: info@barnabasclothing.com

Thank you!
We hope you will join us in making a difference!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BarnabasClothes

Twitter: https://twitter.com/BarnabasLife

Pinterest: http://pinterest.com/barnabas/

Website: http://www.BarnabasClothing.com

Instagram: @barnabasclothing

story:
Hi! my name is Viviana Parra,

I'm passionate about fashion and design, I started my career in Venezuela in 2014 doing my first sewing course, I began doing clothes for myself, then I did for my family and they liked so much that they encouraged me to start my own brand.

In 2015 I started my project and named CAMEL, the name is due to my favourite colour, and the symbol of the brand is the orchid which has a very important meaning for me and is also the national flower from my beautiful country Venezuela.

After making clothes I started practising making bags with pieces of cloth until I perfected the first designs to put them on sale. Two years later I started studying fashion design and when I ended up, due to the difficult economic situation to start my business I left Venezuela and right now I work full time in the development of the brand.

Every Bag is handmade by myself, taking care of every detail and quality. All start in my head with the idea then I put it on paper and chose the best fabrics to make it happen and can give you exclusive bags.

At this time it is necessary to invest in two points;
First in marketing, to announce the brand in new markets through social networks. The development of the brand as an online store will allow us to keep costs low and reach more people in different markets in a more economical way than through conventional retail strategies.

The second point for the investment will be in manufacturing, for that, it's necessary to expand production by buying better machines and employ trained staff to raise the product quality.

Making this project I will have the opportunity to move forward in my dream of establishing Camel as a recognized brand, and reach more people to show it in different markets.

story:
WE LAUNCHED A FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN TO RAISE MONEY FOR OUR BUSINESS AND OUR CAUSE. HERE'S HOW IT WORKS... 

  1. YOU "CONTRIBUTE" TO OUR CAMPAIGN BY SELECTING A "PERK" (buttons on right) THAT WOULD MAKE AN AMAZING ONE OF A KIND CHRISTMAS GIFT! 
  2. WE HANDCRAFT YOUR "PERK" AND SHIP THE ITEM TO YOU BEFORE CHRISTMAS! 
  3. IT'S A WIN-WIN. YOU WIN, BY GETTING AN AWESOME HANDCRAFTED PRODUCT & WE WIN, BY RAISING MONEY FOR OUR BUSINESS & OUR CAUSE!

HERE LET US BREAK IT DOWN FOR YOU AND KEEP SCROLLING TO SEE THESE AWESOME PERKS

WHY THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN?

It's Simple Really

  • We’ve developed handcrafted products that people want 
  • We’re selling everything we make
  • We need to make MORE so we can sell MORE and therefore do MORE GOOD

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Three Ways 

  • BUY A PERK - It's no secret, we're seeking funding, funding to acquire the resources we need to take our brand to a national... no... global level 
  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN - Share with your friends, their friends, your family, someone else's family, co-workers, basically everyone you know 
  • THE DYNAMIC DUO - Buy a perk AND share this campaign.... Whoa, that could be HUGE  

WHAT DO YOU GET?

A Timeless Handcrafted Leather Product That Will Become More Beautiful With Age And The Satisfaction That You've Done A Lot of Good   

Here, let us show you. Please meet our most popular creation yet... 

The Outdoor Office 

Finally the solution you've been looking for! Carry your tablet, an old fashioned notebook, and other essentials for productivity on the go. 

Handcrafted Style & Function

The Outdoor Office is the perfect solution for someone who has embraced the latest technology yet still appreciates the flexibility and ease of a simple notebook. Just watch the short video below to just how functional this product can be. (*iPad not included)


BUT DON'T STOP THERE... 

CHECK OUT OUR OTHER PERKS BELOW...

The Feed / Hope Strap

".... Be not simply good; Be good for something" - Henry David Thoreau

We built this business around 2 non-profit organizations we wanted to support. 25% of our profit goes directly to these two organizations which provide FOOD for hungry families or HOPE for children in need of therapy.

Please see below for more about the organizations we support. 

The (Veg Tan) Smallet

The ultimate front pocket wallet or combination business card holder. 

You'll be amazed at how something so small and simple can become so cherished and valued as it darkens with age and use. Veg Tan is a very popular leather that truly expresses the journey you carry it through. Whether you're looking for a simple everyday carry or a special spot for your business cards, you will not be disappointed. 

The Horween Minimalist Wallet

Handcrafted Refinement With a Minimalist Touch & Accented Style

With this design we were determined to trim the wallet fat... Why do we all insist on carrying all that STUFF in our wallet?... Seriously, when was the last time you got to the checkout counter and showed them "All Your Cards". Nobody wants to see that, it's embarrassing. 

WE SAY... Let's save the Fat for our Bacon and eliminate the notion that butt cheek dents are cool. 

WE SAY... Let's turn back the clock to a time where a man would flaunt his moustache rather than his butt stash...  

The Barnwood Belt

Simple in Design Yet Worthy To Stand the Test of Time 

When we decided to offer a belt we only wanted to offer 2 things... Leather and Steel... No bonding... No stitching... No fillers... just a belt you could wear for decades and use to rappel out of the occasional window, should the need arise. 

Just remember - Black belt, Black shoes... Brown Belt, Brown shoes... So buy both.  

The Mini Outdoor Office (NEW)

The functionality of the original meets the mini version of the technology. 

Built to carry any tablet of equal or smaller size than the iPad Mini. Have you ever read a book on your Kindle and wanted to take notes or jot down thoughts? Now you have a place to do both. 

The Journey Strap

Life's a journey. Thanks for participating in ours. 

At Barnwood Leather we believe that purpose defines action and action develops character. When you own one of our products you not only know you did a lot of GOOD, but you also have a pretty awesome story to tell. - Journey On!  

FEED / HOPE 

(Our Inspiration)

Learn more about these two organizations by clicking the links below

FEED - Mexico Ministry Mission

HOPE - Stormhaven Youth Ranch

story:
Help Launch our new sandal line that we have partnered with Kenyan Artisan to make Eco-friendly footwear,while helping the girl child.

jokhas/ jo-kars, noun    (Swahili for GEM)                                                                                            

JokhasFootwear is launching an eco-friendly, footwear product line that takes into big consideration our human impact on this planet. The world is becoming one unit; we are living in a world where humans are trying to watch out for each other across national boundaries. Not only must we learn how to live with each other peacefully, but we must learn to live in good accordance with the environment and always GIVING FORWARD. At Jokhas, we are setting an example of how to support the unsupported and educate the underprivileged all in an eco-friendly manner.

The Maasai Warrior in All of Us!!!


Here's our Story. 

 

We were born and raised in Kenya. After High School, we came to the USA to further our studies. During our travels back and forth from USA to Kenya, we started noticing some interesting facts. Poverty was still rampant all over Africa, un-employment was an everyday problem, and to fix this, education has to be emphasized. Something had to be done from a grassroots level, create awareness and try and be a part of the solution to one or all of these issues. We started visiting schools, workshops and factories just to see how things operated. It is during a couple of these visits that we met Maasai artisans who made very artistic and stylish sandals using a Maasai beading tradition, some leather and recycled car tires. This was a brilliant idea; it included the African culture and eco-friendly footwear. If a Maasai in Africa can come up with an idea to be eco-friendly, why can’t the whole world be eco-friendly? All these hardworking artisans were lacking was market access and a modern design input. 


Men 

 Women 




This will give much need employment to the artisans in a country where the 45.9% of people live at the poverty line and empower the marginalized in society. We strive to use recycled and recyclable materials whenever possible. Our entire process is set up to eliminate nearly all the waste from traditional production. We're taking a fresh look at how sandals are produced - we're not limited by "how it's always been done" and we're free to set up the system from the bottom-up to be more efficient, more consistent, and more responsible We decided to start a social-business with these artisans for them to produce eco-friendly footwear and we will use some of the profits to address the problems that we hate to see.

Only Available During the Indiegogo Campaign 


60 years ago the Universal Declaration of Human Rights agreed that education is a basic human right for all children. The question often asked, why is it that in 47 out of 54 African countries, do girls have less than 50% chance of going to secondary school?

In many countries dropout rates also increase with age as the economic and social pressures that adolescents girls face and there families face make continues school attendance unsustainable. One of the taboos which is both a social and economic issue is sexual health and reproduction. Lack of proper sanitation during menstrual cycles are particular a large problem. 

 Over 850,000 girls miss 6 weeks of school every year , according to UNICEF 2007 report, a girl in primary school between class 6 and 8 ( Middle school ) loses about 18 weeks out of 108 school weeks. A girl in high school (4 years) loses 156 learning days, which is equivalent to almost 24 weeks out of 144 weeks of school. Because of poverty, most use pieces of dirty rugs, cotton wool, leaves and paper. Some even wash and recycle depending on their locations (rural/ urban). These practices expose them to diseases and discomfort. Statistics prove that it is still a scarce commodity and not accessible to about 3,000,000 girls, it owing to poverty and awareness. Collectively 65% of women and girls in Kenya cannot afford sanitary pads. The period around puberty especially early teenage (13-17) is one in which many girls drop out of school or are absent from school for significant periods of time.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW!!!!

It takes a whole village to raise a child – African Proverb 



 


How will your money help us? 

We have the design, tooling and logistics ready to launch the production; however we don't have the personal funds to kick start a sizeable batch. We want to offer lasso at a fair price and retain the high-quality standard that we are accustomed to.  If the funding campaign proves successful we will be able to place large orders for all the necessary materials: rubber, wool-felt, leather and laces. On top of that, we all have different feet! Each different size requires a unique cutting die. We have dies for a few sizes already, but we are still missing some numbers to complete the whole range, from 30 to 46 ;) 



Our 5 YEAR GUARANTEE!

We are very confident about our quality, that if any part of your JOKHAS sandals becomes defective under normal use (i.e. instep strap breaks off, separation between upper, outsole, and sidestrap), we will gladly replace it with a NEW pair! Simply follow our return policy procedure by mailing us your defective pair and we will send you a new one. Normal wear and tear does not qualify. 

How can I be part of Jokhas.

All of our sandals are handmade and has a personal touch of its own. We are empowering artisan and at the same time, doing a social good to society by supporting and discussing social ills and how we can tackle them. To support us, click back This Project or select one of the rewards to the right.

OUR PROBLEM! We understand this may be a huge concern for you. You (our backers & customers) are our MOST VALUABLE asset in your business! Without you, we wouldn't have a business. So, we want to make sure that you have the most pleasurable experience when you shop for

THANK YOU!

Thank you So much for the support! We will not let you down.

Shoe Size

story: Ever since I was a little kid, I have always wanted to start something for people. Recently, I came up with the idea: why not create a sunglasses company? I know, another sunglasses company, there's plenty in the world. The twist is that my company will be making great quality glasses, without breaking the bank. Why pay hundreds for the same quality, when you can pay less? Your pledge means the world to me and I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

story:
• Case Size: 48mm
  • Plating: Matte Black or Gold
  • Strap: High Grade Silicon or Steel
  • Movement: Japanese
  • Clasp: Jewelry Style Deployment Buckle
  • Back: Stainless Steel
  • Crystal: Mineral
  • Functionality: Multi-function
  • Water Resistant: 3ATM


Simplicity Without Compromise

Our new watch features a multifunction movement with 3 sub dials with a 60 second timer, day of the week hand, and a day of the month hand. All movements controlled by one... Single... Knob. 


The new Flex Watch features crystal glass, micron gold plating, a stainless steel backplate, and is now water resistant up to 100 feet! 


All prices here include standard shipping!



Why Indiegogo?

We chose Indiegogo to continue our campaign because YOU are the reason we get to create watches we love. We are so stoked to show you what we've been working on and this is just the beginning.  Together, we will continue to write the Flex story and create watches that fit simply into our lives.

Estimated Delivery

Each reward tier may have a different estimated shipment window. While we do not expect these to change, it is possible that the estimated shipment month may shift. At anytime up until your watch has shipped, you may request a full refund by emailing info@flexwatches.com

Shipping

We are excited to announce that we will ship worldwide, with the exception of Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Warranty

Each watch has a 2 year limited warranty and a 30 day money back guarantee after receiving it. For more information, please see www.flexwatches.com

Need help? We're here for you!

If you have questions about Flex Watches or our campaign, you can email us at info@flexwatches.com or call us at 213.455.4118.

story:
The Hoodie

A hooded sweatshirt for everyone!

  • Front side sports a guardian spirit: the loyal Wakeful Wolf, a symbol of courage and perseverance.
  • Celebrate spring and rival the colors of fall!
  • A vibrant print with sharp details (300 dpi).
  • Ultra durable colors. The design will not crack, peel or fade thanks to dye-sublimation technique.
  • Cut & Sew. No wrinkles or blank spots under armpits.
  • 100% polyester (полиестер, poliéster, polüester, πολυεστέρας, poileistear, poliestere, poliesteris, poliészter, poliester, polyesteri)
    fleece, a soft and cozy feeling not unlike cotton.
  • A kangaroo pocket carries your hands, your snacks or your baby kangaroo.
  • Hood can be tightened with a flat white drawstring.
  • A black liner for the hood, as well as black knit cuffs and a black waistband. 
  • Blacklight reactive. The effect is light, but noticeable.
  • Available in sizes XS to 5XL.
  • Ships with a certificate of authenticity.
  • Made in USA by Ink Strategies.

Measurement Details

Table of all measurements in centimeters:

 

 

Who is Making the Wakeful Hoodie?

I'm Sylvia Ritter, a digital artist gone fashion designer from Germany. My artworks have been commissioned by festivals and record labels, musicians and book authors as well as publishers and game companies. In my free time I also create art for personal projects. You may know my Ubuntu Animals series or my ongoing series of animal-themed tarot cards. Click here for my full portfolio.

The Wakeful Hoodie is my first foray into fashion design. I wanted to create a unique piece of clothing for unique people, while relying on professional quality that we all have come to expect, with the help of my partner Ink Strategies (formerly Semper Vinco), a clothes manufacturer located in Virginia, USA.

 

Return Policy

If you find a manufacturer’s defect or received the wrong size, you have 30 days (starting date of receipt) to exchange the hoodie. Just follow the directions on the packing slip.

If, once you receive your hoodie, you wish to change the size, you will have to pay a fee to cover shipping of a new hoodie. Fill out the exchange form and ship ​your hoodie back to the indicated address.

Exchanges cannot be processed after 30 days past date of receipt.

 

Risks and challenges

The "Wakeful Hoodie" design is finished and has been tested to my satisfaction. I just need to give the manufacturer the order. I have been guaranteed a production time estimate. To avoid possible delivery delays I've also added a time buffer.
