story:
Short Summary

I have been working on these since July of 2014. My work involved me going out of town for 4 to 6 weeks at a time, so I didn't have a great deal of time to work on them. My oldest son was out of work so I had him make a mold of the first products so that I could just dip in paint and sew by lines. (I had no experience using a sewing machine.) I had friends and family try them, and with their input, I have finally got to the final product that I am proud to see on the store shelves. This was originally meant for those that had limited range of motion, arthritis, or even those in wheelchairs that had to rely on others to wash them. However, after having everyone try them, I noticed that my son-in-law (which is a mechanic) that came home with grease on his hands even after washing, he still had like a stain. Once he used the Exfoliator Body Scrubber, his hands were coming out very clean. That opened the market up to just about anyone that would like to get a whole body cleansing without relying on others. Once you use one it is hard to go back to the original products that you were using. They also replace many of the products that are cluttering up your shower. My goal is to see my products on the shelves at the stores. I am the only one making them at this time, so I couldn't possibly supply a chain of stores with a large order without having the means to do so. I would like to find a manufacturer that can work with me, making sure that the quality is number one at all times.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are looking to raise a minimum of $25,000. This is to get set up in a manufacturing environment instead of my dining room. Either I find a manufacturer preferably local, to help me get these mass produced. The money would be used for materials, hiring help for the orders before a manufacturer and machines and employees if I have to do it myself. Like I said my goal is to get these on the shelves to stores that sell bathing products. 
  • For those that contribute $1.00 to $24.99, your name will be posted on our website's supporters page. 

  • For $25.00 to $49.99 you will receive 1 body scrubber (your choice of style), color will depend on what is available. Plus, your name will be posted on the supporters page on our website. Once we reach the goal, we ask 4 to 6 weeks to deliver products. However, as we are getting the support I will be making them, so most likely some will receive them much sooner.

    Estimated delivery: Apr 2016

    Ships anywhere in the world


  • All pledges of $50 and above will receive 2 body scrubbers of your choice of style, color will depend on what is available. Plus, your name will be posted on the supporters page on our website. Once we reach the goal we ask 4 to 6 weeks to deliver products. However, as we are getting the support I will be making them, so most likely some will receive them much sooner.

    Estimated delivery: Apr 2016

    Ships anywhere in the world


  • If we cannot reach the goal, I will still use the money to continue to get more of The Body Scrubbers out until they are well known and we can get them in stores. Just by word of mouth, we are already getting business, even before I was ready to get this all launched. 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • There are separate products out there that do only one thing such as exfoliate your face or within your reach. Those products have to be held tight or they will fall out of your hand. These Body Scrubbers are made to help those that cannot grip tightly for any amount of time, you just slip your hand in one mitt, soap up the back, grab the back with the mitt that you have on, put it behind you to where you can easily slip your other hand in the other mitt and the fun begins. It helped one of my family friends that is 93 years old. He had trouble walking because his circulation wasn't very good. He said that he sat in his shower and just scrubbed up and down with the body scrubber at least 3 times on his back and in a few days he noticed that he didn't need to be leaning on walls, tables, chairs or anything because he could feel his legs and feet much better.
  • I also want to try to get the packaging better. Like I said, at the moment, I am the only one making these. I turned my dining room into a mini warehouse so right now I use my own printer and these are so light weight it is easy to wrap them in plastic wrap. 

Risks & Challenges

Main risks and challenges are to keep up with the demand. Just by word of mouth, I am getting orders and people love them. I am willing to become a manufacturer if necessary, because many manufacturers do not want to work with the nylon netting in so many layers, but I have created a way to easily work with it and am able to make them very well and easily. I am not a professional seamstress, but I did get the patterns made professionally helping me make 3 sizes and all look the same. Materials have been a problem also, but I have found some that work with me, but I haven't bought large orders from them yet so the price is still a little higher at the moment.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute, that is no problem, but I would deeply appreciate it if you passed the word on to others. You can use the tools right here on the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

My oldest son was out of work so I had him make a mold of the first products so that I could just dip in paint and sew by lines. (I had no experience using a sewing machine.) I had friends and family try them, and with their input, I have finally got to the final product that I am proud to see on the store shelves. This was originally meant for those that had limited range of motion, arthritis, or even those in wheelchairs that had to rely on others to wash them. However, after having everyone try them, I noticed that my son-in-law (which is a mechanic) that came home with grease on his hands even after washing, he still had like a stain. story:
Short Summary

I am Rosa Polin, a senior at Bard College, and I am trying to raise money to put on FLAWLESS, my senior show in photography. The senior show is required at Bard and reflects the culmination of my time in the photography program.  I cannot be more excited to see what I have been working towards for the past year take its final form, but in order to get to that point I will need to raise money to print, matte, frame and install my work.

FLAWLESS deals with performance and sexuality. Photography at once feigns authenticity and calls attention to itself as artifice. To use photography to deal with sexuality  is to attempt to assign form to something which is necessarily intangible, fluid and ambiguous. The portraits made in FLAWLESS attempt to deal with this tension. 



What I Need 

Photography majors at Bard are required to put on a senior show and are expected to fund them on their own. I'm thrilled to have the opportunity to do this but to really pull it off will require more money than I've ever had to spend. My project calls for large prints. My photographs are confrontational, often nude, portraits. The prints need to assert themselves forcefully and immediately with a strong physical power. In the best of all possible worlds I'll be able to make around 15 20 x 25 inch prints and be able to matte and frame them. One final print, matted and framed would cost me around $150 to make. This brings the minimum amount of money I need to do this show successfully to a total of $2,250. Any contribution no matter how small will bring me closer to my goal, which I realize is ideal. 

Challenges

I understand that the fundraising goal I've put forward is steep. I want to stress that any amount I raise through this campaign will make a significant difference, as my senior show fund hinges on approximately $0 thus far. I'm offering sweet perks if you're a super gracious donor and would like to claim them <3

Other Ways You Can Help

As a student whose connections are mostly to other students, I truly understand if you're unable to contribute- but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please get the word out by sharing the link to this page all over the internet! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you so much! I love you all!

story:
A Swiss watch for new times.

Archetypical design without frills.

As confident as its owner.

We call it «Bólido», Spanish for meteor. A luminary that crosses between the somewhat immovable fixed stars of established brands on the watch firmament. A timepiece with surprising qualities at a completely un-Swiss price.​

 

  

Bólido is 100% Swiss made

The new Federal Ordinance, in force since 1 Jan 2017 makes it difficult to launch a reasonably priced ‘Swiss Made’ mechanical watch. While movement and assembly always had to be Swiss, parts such as the watch cases that require expensive forging tooling and multiple labour-intensive operations must now have at least 60% Swiss content. The capacities of suppliers that use the usual production methods are absorbed by the big luxury brands which are able to afford their high costs.

 

The Bólido​ Concept

We therefore chose to manufacture the Bólido case employing automatic lathing machines; in contrast to traditional case production, this so-called ‘décolletage’ is highly competitive and there is ample capacity for it in Switzerland. Sophisticated lathing machines are even able to do the finishing and polishing simultaneously.

 

‘Intelligent design’          

It did not bother us that this method leaves very little room for fancy design, however! On the contrary, Bólido was intended to be bold and out of step. Adding a second rotative axis not only tilts the face of the watch to facilitate time-reading in situations like car-driving, etc.; it also increases the case height at the top of the dial to allow the integration of a large winding crown in an unusual but well protected position.

 

Lathing also facilitates the implementation of yet another feature of the Bólido design:

The Bólido monocoque case construction

With it, the movement with its dial and hands is inserted into the case from the top. This unusual construction eliminates a third of the parts, including the case back and gasket – what is not there cannot leak and costs nothing! This kind of systematic exploration of production-specific properties has allowed us to build the Bólido entirely in Switzerland economically and with the same high quality that applies to famous luxury brands.

 

 

The heart of the Bólido: the self-winding mechanical movement

The movement is supplied to us by a leading manufacturer and is hand-assembled by highly skilled craftsmen and women. The cost of such a movement relates to two main factors:

  • Accuracy of adjustment in several position-angles
  • The finishing of the parts: enhancing the precision by reducing tolerances to broaden the range of adjustability; the beauty of such finishing is a welcome side effect.

We do not cut corners in either of these two areas. On the contrary: the Bólido movements are built to our exacting specifications of regulation in 5 positions (instead of the usual 3), and the meticulous finishing is underscored by Geneva stripes and engine-turned decoration.

 
The dial face         

The dial and hands match Bólido’s functionality; we spent a significant amount of time searching for the best readability from different angles, distances and in varying light conditions. We finally chose the simplicity of a generic instrument scale, because reinventing the wheel will not make it better; SuperLuminova plots on the dial and hands enable excellent reading in darkness.

      

Band and folding buckle

The band is hand cast in natural latex-based rubber; it is highly resistant to saltwater, hence its popularity amongst professional divers. It only requires a rinse with soap once in a while to keep it looking like new, even after many years. A quality watch is recognisable by its buckle, but even luxury brands often charge extra for an elaborate folding buckle with a safety clasp as is used for Bólido.​

 

Box

 

Bólido quality​​​​​​​​

  • Surgical grade stainless steel case
  • Scratch-resistant sapphire crystal
  • Water resistant to 100m / 330ft, every watch tested prior to shipment
  • Exclusive natural rubber strap
  • Adjustable stainless steel folding buckle
  • Swiss Mechanical Automatic Movement regulated in 5 positions
  • 44 hours power reserve

In spite of its fashionable size, Bólido watches fit to almost every wrist-size, even very small ones. This is because the distance between the axes of the two springbars holding the band-ends underneath the case is only 32 mm. Regular gents watches of comparable size have a typical axis-distance of 42 mm or more.

 

Experience

Simon Husslein has designed watches for Ventura, Braun and NOMOS Glashütte and received numerous awards internationally.

Pierre Nobs is a veteran entrepreneur and was the founder of the Ventura Watch Company.

Our combined experience enables us to communicate what we actually want to our suppliers and how it has to be done, rather than just buying what is offered; in fact, every single part of the Bólido timepiece is custom-made to match our exigence for quality and design.

    

Work in progress

     

Service     

What watch start-ups and watch buyers often forget is that a mechanical timepiece is as good as its after-sale care; any elaborate warranty is worthless if it is not backed by solid, bricks and mortar service facilities that stock all the necessary parts. Our business plan includes sufficient spare parts to last at least 10 years right from the start of production. A two year warranty covers all manufacturing faults and material defects. And you'll find Bólido Service Centres with highly skilled watch makers to provide maintenance and repairs in:

  • Switzerland: Bólido Uhrenservice, Glarnerstr. 25, 8854 Siebnen
  • Germany (for the EU): Ventura Watches, Gattingerstr. 11, 97076 Wuerzburg
  • USA: Swisservice Inc., 1774 East Herbert Avenue, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
  • Japan: Preciluxe Co. Ltd., 〒227-0067 神奈川県横浜市青葉区松風台14-41

And one more thing: when our regular e-shop opens after this campaign it will efficiently facilitate and transact all your servicing needs online.

 
Standard retail prices

After the Indiegogo InDemand campaign the watches will be offered at standard retail prices:

  • BÓLIDO WHITE | BÓLIDO BLACK: € | CHF | US$ 650.-
  • BÓLIDO YELLOW | BÓLIDO RED | BÓLIDO PEBBLE: € | CHF | US$ 690.-

 

Regarding VAT, GST and Sales-tax

VAT, GST and Sales-tax are already included in your pledge if you reside in one of the
following countries/ areas:

  • Australia
  • Bahamas
  • China
  • EU (European Union)
  • Indonesia
  • Israel
  • Japan
  • Korea
  • Mexico
  • New Zealand
  • Malaysia
  • Puerto Rico
  • Saudi Arabia
  • Singapore
  • South
  • Africa
  • Switzerland
  • Taiwan
  • Thailand
  • UAE
  • USA : we cover the import duty

For all other countries: there might be no tax at all. We will ship at the pledged amount and you
have to cover any taxes on receipt (only if there are any); to compensate, we add a replacement
band free of charge to the package.

 

      

 

They are talking about us

ENGLISH: revolution.watch | watchesbysjx.com | tempusfugit.watch | blessthisstuff.com | stylepark.com | trendhunter.com | freshersmag.com | coolmaterial.com | thatdope.com | gessato.com | thetimebum.com | hautehorlogerie.org | fayadigital.com | timetotalk.se | xtrememeantime | timezone.com

DEUTSCH: bellevue.nzz.ch | stylepark.com | armbanduhren-online.de | hochparterre.ch | tick-talk.ch | uhrforum.de | goldor.ch

FRENCH: hautehorlogerie.org | lapetitetrotteuse.com | businessmontres.com

JAPANESE: gressive.jp

SWEDISH: klockrent.cafe.se

RUSSIAN: forum.watch.ru

 

Reach us

www.bolido.rocks

www.facebook.com > bolido

To download videos, images and text please email  info@bolido.rocks

Bólido® is a registered Trademark. The Bólido timepiece is an internationally registered model. Copyright® 2017 by Bólido. All rights reserved.

story:
We can help Reece!

He may be, one of the best players in CCSU history.

First player in school history to be named All-American.

2013 MLS SuperDraft Candidate.

NEC player of the year...

We have a chance to help him follow his dream.

From Reece.

I am reaching out to you all to help me continue chasing my goal of becoming a great professional footballer. I have gotten to travel the globe playing the game I love. I feel that I am extremely fortunate and will continue to work as hard as I can to become the best player I can.

The next step in my dream is traveling to different parts of the United States as well as neighbouring countries to trial with professional teams this US summer.

In order to achieve this I need to pay my way there and all expenses that are associated with it. Being a non US citizen I am unable to work in America at this time.

I am in the process for applying for my OPT, which will allow me to stay in America for another 12 months after graduation. In which time I plan on hopefully successfully trialling at a number of professional clubs and signing a pro contract.

Obviously I can't promise results. What I can promise, is my 100% dedication to becoming the best player I can be.

Everything I do, I do because I believe it betters me as an athlete and a person. I take pride and humility in my natural ability and I work hard everyday to better myself.

Diet and health is a huge part of my life and success so far. I dedicate a lot of energy into learning about what really fuels me and how I can use nutrition to my advantage on the pitch.

I also understand the importance of being a well-rounded athlete. This means that I incorporate a strict weight lifting regime as well as outdoor training to help improve my strengths on the pitch.

By contributing, you will be directly helping me pursue my dream. And for that, I greatly appreciate you.

Football is my passion and I hope my career continues to bring me many more great moments, both on and off the pitch, as I have already experienced so far.

Here’s to hoping I can share many more good memories with you over the coming years. Thanks for the continued support.

- Reece

A little more about me

I began playing soccer at age 6 for Croydon Athletic in London, England. At 10, I was selected to play for his borough of Sutton as well as the county of Surrey at a regional level I signed as a youth player for Milwall FC at 11 years old. I later went on to play for the U18 squad at Crystal Palace FC, and also made numerous first team appearances for Carshalton Athletic.

I went on to sign a letter of intent to William Carey University in Mississippi, LA. After two years there I decided to transfer to Central Connecticut State University in order to expand my competition at a NCAA D1 program.

I am now set to graduate from CCSU in May of 2013. I am taking this time now to train hard and prepare for professional trials shortly after that.

I have a Facebook page and Instagram you can follow my training and progress on there. I’ll be posting some videos and insights into what’s going on.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that a direct financial contribution may not be how you would best like to support me. So I had the idea of setting up an Amazon wish list of training tools that I cannot afford. I would love to incorporate these items into my training. You may follow the link and check out how you can help there.

http://www.amazon.com/registry/giftlist/2TRM0HL...

Share the page with others who you think my like to be apart of my dream. Follow me on Instagram and Facebook for some real insight into my daily routine, diet, training and preparation. Maybe some cool like experiences along the way too.
story_txt:
We can help Reece!
He may be, one of the best players in CCSU history.
First player in school history to be named All-American.
2013 MLS SuperDraft Candidate.
NEC player of the year...
We have a chance to help him follow his dream.
From Reece.
I am reaching out to you all to help me continue chasing my goal of becoming a great professional footballer. I have gotten to travel the globe playing the game I love. I feel that I am extremely fortunate and will continue to work as hard as I can to become the best player I can.
The next step in my dream is traveling to different parts of the United States as well as neighbouring countries to trial with professional teams this US summer.
In order to achieve this I need to pay my way there and all expenses that are associated with it. Being a non US citizen I am unable to work in America at this time.
I am in the process for applying for my OPT, which will allow me to stay in America for another 12 months after graduation. In which time I plan on hopefully successfully trialling at a number of professional clubs and signing a pro contract.
Obviously I can't promise results. What I can promise, is my 100% dedication to becoming the best player I can be.
Everything I do, I do because I believe it betters me as an athlete and a person. I take pride and humility in my natural ability and I work hard everyday to better myself.
Diet and health is a huge part of my life and success so far. I dedicate a lot of energy into learning about what really fuels me and how I can use nutrition to my advantage on the pitch.
I also understand the importance of being a well-rounded athlete. This means that I incorporate a strict weight lifting regime as well as outdoor training to help improve my strengths on the pitch.
By contributing, you will be directly helping me pursue my dream. And for that, I greatly appreciate you.
Football is my passion and I hope my career continues to bring me many more great moments, both on and off the pitch, as I have already experienced so far.
Here’s to hoping I can share many more good memories with you over the coming years. Thanks for the continued support. - ReeceA little more about me

story:
The Project

Seraphina Twenty-Eight is the brainchild of Teresa Womack.

With a collaborative effort of Artists and designers under Womack’s direction, she will build a line that encompasses not only the fashion feel but also all the elements in blending the past with present fashion. Seraphina Twenty-Eight is poised to make the Triangle a fashion destination with a global reach and purpose.

Situated in an old world atelier setting, Seraphina Twenty –Eight (S28)

screams high fashion and social awareness. S28 has full access to fashion promotion, show production and models to offer a turnkey fashion experience. Whenever possible the unique artisan touches are sourced or created locally. The fashions, versatile in portability and innovation, will allow for the creation evening wear from daywear with features that can be added and dismissed at whim.

The goal is to tell a story through fashion inspired by Womack’s novel Seraphina: The Discovery. The intriguing narrative of Julia and Seraphina alludes towards a contemporary up-to-date medieval style. The couture line will be sold worldwide. The focus of the designs is creating a luxury investment piece at good value with personalized touches and custom effects that make each piece a unique art to wear.

We believe passionately in the promise of Seraphina Twenty-Eight. Through innovative sensuous design, Seraphina Twenty Eight will create unique fashions with precious fabrics and accessories.

 

Who is Teresa Womack?

Teresa Womack is an award-winning international fashion photographer, author, lyricist, director and actress. She has been cast in television shows, movies, music videos, and infomercials. She competed in ballroom dance on National levels and won top awards. She incorporates this expertise in dance and theatrical stage to modeling runway choreography. Her experience coupled with front and back stage exposure in pageants allows her to be uniquely qualified to design for top talent and celebrities.

Her work has brought in awards in fashion, theatrical, and commercial print and her skills with the camera have been featured for magazine covers, catalogues, advertorials, bands, and CD covers. Her natural muse and innate creative have influenced this fashion line.

 

The Fashion Line

The target client has disposable income and a penchant for luxury items created with care. These women are celebrities or weighing in the celebrity lifestyle. They read the leading fashion magazines; watch the fashion channels and reality shows. They attend high-end black tie affairs and do not want to be seen in the same dress from a major department store as the woman across the room. They shop at upscale boutiques. They are impatient and “busy” so they cannot have fittings with a personal designer but they want the unique and original look as if they did.

 

What We Need:

With your help we can create these one of a kind, socially responsible designs. The goal is to raise $100,000 to fully manufacture the maiden couture fashion line. Below is a list of the incentives contributors will receive with meeting each criterion.

 

Contribution uses:

Your contribution will be used to purchase high-end fabrics, pay Sample makers and pattern drafters for the initial collection. The research and development of new fabrics, fabric designs, as well as, line development, initial manufacturing, professional fees and marketing. 

With your help we can bring the world of Seraphina Twenty-Eight to life.

Thank you for your contributions. Please spread the word to your fashion-ista friends and family.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily at this time, you can still spread the word to help manufacture the creation of Seraphina Twenty-Eight  by using the Indiegogo share tools and social media. We also have investment opportunities available(Email  teresa@seraphinainternational.com for more information).  As the line becomes reality you can still take pride that you helped our vision & goal become a reality. “Life is not as we perceive it, but it is the reality for which we choose.”—Seraphina: The Discovery.

story:
Think back…

How often have you tried on a piece of outfit and realize that it does not fit you perfectly? Too long? Too loose on the sides? Arm holes are too huge?

How often you realized that you are a UK8 for tops, but a UK10 for bottoms?

How often are clothes purchased by you, online, neglected or given away?

Have you ever feel mood and confidence dampen because your clothes are not perfectly fitting, styles are not the best for you as well?

That’s because current UK and US size guides are too standardized and outdated. No one is a perfect UK 8 or US 10. Body sizes and shapes differ in each individual, especially for us, Asians.

 

Imagine... you can go shopping freely, seeing clothes that look nice and you think it may look good on you, and you are able to buy one that is MADE TO YOUR SIZE…

Imagine... when you shop, only those clothes that fit your current style and liking are presented to you, then you can pick and choose… yes of course all will be MADE TO FIT YOUR EXACT SIZE…

Imagine... there is someone, who can scour the world to find ALL those clothes that you may like based on your current whim and fancy, so that you have almost unlimited choice of clothing… AND yes, all those that you wanted will be MADE TO YOUR EXACT SIZE…

And these are the reasons why ChrisKyla is here, because we believe that clothes should fit you, you needn’t fit clothes.

Clothes define you! Wearing the most perfectly fitting outfits boost your confidence. You become more socially accepted and improve work performances.

ChrisKyla aims to widen women’s choices to get perfectly fitted clothes by providing end-to-end value chain of bespoke alteration from clothing purchased online.

 

With the help of Idiegogo and people like you, we will be able to start ChrisKyla here in Singapore and turn ChrisKyla into a reality! We have been working on this idea for close to 8 months and this is the first milestone we have to conquer, in order to get it running.

The dresses and tops are limited editions Exclusive to this project (check out the rewards section!). We spent time to source for quality fabric and take pride in the workmanship of our final product. The best part? It will be MADE TO YOUR SIZE!

The money raised will go to the production of the dresses and tops. Most importantly, it will be used to fund the development of our very own ChrisKyla website.

With ChrisKyla, we promise that female online shoppers will no longer fuss over the fitting and style of clothes they purchased online. That also means, less wastage and save more on your spending!
 

 

 



We've got some sweet rewards for our supporters, and we hope you'll give us the opportunity to return the generosity to you.

Pledge of $10 or more – A video thank you card, plus a deep appreciation from ChrisKyla, for funding us.

Pledge of $30 or more – A video thank you card, plus a deep appreciation from ChrisKyla, for funding us.

Pledge of $60 or more - A made to your size, nicely designed ChrisKyla peplum top.

Shipment: Free delivery within Singapore. Please top up USD20 for delivery to other parts of Asia.

Pledge of $100 or more – A made to your size, nicely designed ChrisKyla “Little Black Dress” done by our in-house seamstress.

Shipment: Free delivery within Singapore. Please top up USD20 for delivery to other parts of Asia.

*Do take note that all transactions will be in USD.

 

Pledge $60 to get a Made to you size Peplum top

Front view of the Peplum top, Back view of the Peplum top as shown above.

 

Pledge $100 to get a Made to your size, the Little Black dress

Front view and Low back design of the Little Black Dress shown above.

 

 

What Sizes are Available?

Your size is always available. (Isn’t it awesome? Of course, we will need some measurements from you.) 

 

How do You Get My Size?

After you pledge for Chriskyla x Indiegogo project, we will send you an email as soon as possible (check your spam mail too!) and we sincerely hope that you can provide us with some details. This information will show your support to ChrisKyla, and it will enhance the way we serve you when ChrisKyla becomes a reality!

 

When will I receive my clothes?

~2weeks after end of project. Lend us your patience as we handle all the nitty gritty paperwork.

 

Share the good stuff…

We can't do this without you, so if you share our story, please help us by spreading the word.

We're Facebook addicts, and just set up a brand new ChrisKyla page! You can truly help us out by sharing the link and telling your friends. We'll be giving away a LBD to one of our Facebook fans at the end of our Indiegogo campaign, so make sure to "like" our new page!

We like to jot down every ups, downs, struggles, gone wrongs, and sweet successes of our story. To follow our stories, you can visit us at http://chriskyla.tumblr.com/

 

 

Spread the word! Tweet it! Email your friends! Post to Facebook! Help us get press!
Share this news with bloggers, journalists, etc! TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW!

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED. CHECK THE NEW CAMPAIGN AT

http://igg.me/at/knitting4cancerpatients-5 or

https://life.indiegogo.com/fundraisers/knitting-for-cancer-patients-v-edition/x/8501418

**************************************************************************

Hello again. My name is Ricardo Villamizar.

Four months ago I decided to start a campaing: To knit one wool cap per day, and give them all to cancer patients by the end of the month.

The three previous campaigns were successful: I made the hats and I donated them to cancer patients at the "Carlos Andrade Marín", in Quito, Ecuador. But the most important gifts for me were the friends I made; the courage, hope, and happiness of the cancer patients, and learning from the people who help their neighbours.

This month I want to replicate the campaign. I hope this time more people get involved and help me to reach the goal:

"Bringing happiness, hope and affection, one hat per day".

I just need:

  • The money is needed for buying new wool. Some is used to print new "bussiness" cards, letters and photocopying. I need a very small part for transportation and per diem. (If I ask for $500 is only because that amount is the lower limit here at IndieGoGo).
  • And you get:

  • Again, I will knit some wool caps as rewards, with the same pattern and appearance of the previous month caps. They will also be double-sided; will have the same size and thermal insulation. The colors will vary, so everybody will be happy. If the rewards are not claimed by the end of the month, they will be saved as perks for the next campaign. (To see the images, check the "Updates" and "Gallery" sections).
Acknowledgements:

Specially, to the president of the "Oncological Patients Association", Mrs. Martha de Padrón, and all the collaborators who guided, introduced and helped me to carry out the donation.

And to our beloved friend, Amparo Díaz Uribe, inspiration for this campaing, who passed away on december 25.  Te llevamos en nuestro pensamiento, palabra y acción. 

Conclusion :

The previous campaigns were fascinating experiences: I learned a lot, and now I deeply appreciate the work of the voluntaries. Above all, the resolution, happiness and hope of the cancer patients is the most inspiring stimulus for me to keep on knitting.

You can also help a lot during this new campaign, by sharing it on your social media.

Thanks in advance.

Ricardo V.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Kirsten, although most people know my business name of Fabric Dragon.  I had an awful time in school, largely due to an undiagnosed learning disability, and put off college because I just couldn't imagine going through that anymore.

I spent the time learning my business the hard way. I started in costuming and fabric sales before finally developing a steady business selling custom made jewelry.  I love making things that are unique, so that even if I try I cannot make exactly the same thing twice! (I also sell beads and supplies for the people who prefer to make their own.)

At 44 I finally decided that I was ready to try this whole "school" thing again, and enrolled in The Art Institute of Philadelphia, pursing a B.S. in Fashion Design. It was tough after being out of school for so long, but I only wish I had done it sooner!

In school we have projects that get increasingly complex as we get closer to graduating. We produce a line of clothing a lot like you see on those fashion shows, starting with just a few items, and leading up to our senior collections which have several complete outfits.

As you might expect from my background, I like unique fabrics and embellishments.  Which is where this campaign comes in...

This quarter I had a project in school where I was needle felting designs into a coat. (Needle felting means meshing the fibers together with several sharp barbed needles.) It turned out to be a huge task that will take way more time than I thought, so I looked into a needle felting machine...

and fell in love.

Things I would never be able to do by hand were easy with that machine.  As it happens I know vendors who sell scraps of kimono fabrics, saris, and other beautiful fibers. This machine would let me mesh those fabrics and fibers together to create one-of-a-kind fabrics I can make into irreproducable clothes and accessories.

NO ONE would ever be able to have exactly the same purse, or jacket, or whatever because the actual fabrics would be made JUST for that item.

Not only  would this be fabulous for the coat I was embellishing, it would be something spectacular for my senior collection.  No one could have anything like it, because not only did I design that jacket, I made the fabric! Wow!

As it happens I know a number of people in the fashion industry (I know, a shock, right?). There is a market for up-cycled material, especially in one-of-a-kind wear like corsets and purses and pins.  Several of my friends in the industry have expressed interest in having me create the fabrics for a few items in their line.

In addition, being able to work with any sized scraps of fabric means that I could make pins, clutches or book covers out of scraps from your wedding dress, or other special occassion outfit, even if the pieces left over were really odd shapes or sizes!  This has gotten some interest from a friend who does wedding planning, and from another friend who makes bridal and prom  wear for a living.

So not only will this project be used for a school project (and possibly for sale in a boutique after it's graded), but it could very well lead to new business immediately!

What We Need & What You Get

There are only a few things I really need for this:

First and foremost i will need a needle felting machine.  After a lot of research I have decided on a Babylock Embellisher.  YES there are other machines that are less expensive, but the Babylock has some of the best reviews for heavy use, and lets you customize the number of needles for different projects (and replace them individually if they break).  My local dealership is also full of great people who offer a LOT of support.

I will also need to buy some fabrics and fibers for this project. In specific, to get the kind of up-cycle-able kimono I want, I have to buy them in ten-pound lots. This will give me a good variety of kimono colors and patterns. I will need some recycled sari fibers and some backing fabrics. I will also need some other yarns and fibers, but these can often be purchased in smaller quantity. (I have beads, trust me there.)

So what *I* get is the tools and materials to make this project go...

and what do YOU get?

PERKS!

What better perks can you get than the products I want to make? Absolutely one of a kind, no one else can ever have one just like it pins, purses, even jackets! Imagine having  a messanger bag, pin, or clutch  that can never, ever, be exactly the same as someone else's! Something that makes people stop and ask where you got it. Something that didn't come from a mass market retailer. Something where you actually helped to CREATE the material itself!

Since I know what itss like to want to help out but be on a limited budget, I even have a perk for $5. For five dollars you can be immortalized in fashion! I will embelish a name (yours or another's) or a simple design (as long as it isn't trademarked) into one of my collection pieces!  You get a photo emailed to you of YOUR contribution to fashion!

I set my goal to allow me to get the machine, some of the fibers and fabrics, and mail your perks.  If I exceed my goal, I will be able to take off time from jewelry making to complete and deliver your perks sooner!

If i do not make my goal I do not get to keep any of the money, as without the machine I cannot create the perks!
 
(Since I will be trying to get this machine in any case, feel free to contact me through Facebook or Etsy about getting one of these perks made in the future.)

Why This Matters

Has there ever been something you always wished you could do? My graduating college with actual good grades is that to me.

In addition, as I said, I love making unique things, and this is about as unique as I can get!

You will be supporting an individual craftswoman, not a big business, who is making things by hand because she loves to, and who is supporting herself and her family through art, instead of spending the same money on "everyone has one" items made who knows where by no one knows who. Get something unique for your money!

I have a long track record of making things that people are happy with.  I have always stood by my products, and most of my business is from repeat customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

I went back to college, so I understand that not everyone has the same kind of money. Right now what money I have goes to books and pet food.  EVERYONE can help though.

Publicity is worth way more than people think.

If you can tell people about this project, you will make a difference!

Share this on Facebook, Tweet it, tell your family to "buy you a pin", or just tell your friends who you know like interesting stuff. It all helps!

And the more often people talk about this project the more likely someone is to decide they would really like that messanger bag...
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, my name is Kirsten, although most people know my business name of Fabric Dragon.  I had an awful time in school, largely due to an undiagnosed learning disability, and put off college because I just couldn't imagine going through that anymore.
I spent the time learning my business the hard way. I started in costuming and fabric sales before finally developing a steady business selling custom made jewelry.  I love making things that are unique, so that even if I try I cannot make exactly the same thing twice! (I also sell beads and supplies for the people who prefer to make their own.)
At 44 I finally decided that I was ready to try this whole "school" thing again, and enrolled in The Art Institute of Philadelphia, pursing a B.S. in Fashion Design. It was tough after being out of school for so long, but I only wish I had done it sooner!
In school we have projects that get increasingly complex as we get closer to graduating. We produce a line of clothing a lot like you see on those fashion shows, starting with just a few items, and leading up to our senior collections which have several complete outfits.
As you might expect from my background, I like unique fabrics and embellishments.  Which is where this campaign comes in...
This quarter I had a project in school where I was needle felting designs into a coat. (Needle felting means meshing the fibers together with several sharp barbed needles.) It turned out to be a huge task that will take way more time than I thought, so I looked into a needle felting machine...
and fell in love.
Things I would never be able to do by hand were easy with that machine.  As it happens I know vendors who sell scraps of kimono fabrics, saris, and other beautiful fibers. This machine would let me mesh those fabrics and fibers together to create one-of-a-kind fabrics I can make into irreproducable clothes and accessories.
NO ONE would ever be able to have exactly the same purse, or jacket, or whatever because the actual fabrics would be made JUST for that item.
Not only  would this be fabulous for the coat I was embellishing, it would be something spectacular for my senior collection.  No one could have anything like it, because not only did I design that jacket, I made the fabric! Wow!
As it happens I know a number of people in the fashion industry (I know, a shock, right?). There is a market for up-cycled material, especially in one-of-a-kind wear like corsets and purses and pins.  Several of my friends in the industry have expressed interest in having me create the fabrics for a few items in their line.
In addition, being able to work with any sized scraps of fabric means that I could make pins, clutches or book covers out of scraps from your wedding dress, or other special occassion outfit, even if the pieces left over were really odd shapes or sizes!  This has gotten some interest from a friend who does wedding planning, and from another friend who makes bridal and prom  wear for a living.
So not only will this project be used for a school project (and possibly for sale in a boutique after it's graded), but it could very well lead to new business immediately!


What We Need & What You Get
There are only a few things I really need for this:
First and foremost i will need a needle felting machine.  After a lot of research I have decided on a Babylock Embellisher.  YES there are other machines that are less expensive, but the Babylock has some of the best reviews for heavy use, and lets you customize the number of needles for different projects (and replace them individually if they break).  My local dealership is also full of great people who offer a LOT of support.
I will also need to buy some fabrics and fibers for this project. In specific, to get the kind of up-cycle-able kimono I want, I have to buy them in ten-pound lots. This will give me a good variety of kimono colors and patterns. I will need some recycled sari fibers and some backing fabrics. I will also need some other yarns and fibers, but these can often be purchased in smaller quantity. (I have beads, trust me there.)
So what *I* get is the tools and materials to make this project go...
and what do YOU get?
PERKS!
What better perks can you get than the products I want to make? Absolutely one of a kind, no one else can ever have one just like it pins, purses, even jackets! Imagine having  a messanger bag, pin, or clutch  that can never, ever, be exactly the same as someone else's! Something that makes people stop and ask where you got it. Something that didn't come from a mass market retailer. Something where you actually helped to CREATE the material itself!
Since I know what itss like to want to help out but be on a limited budget, I even have a perk for $5. For five dollars you can be immortalized in fashion! I will embelish a name (yours or another's) or a simple design (as long as it isn't trademarked) into one of my collection pieces!  You get a photo emailed to you of YOUR contribution to fashion!
I set my goal to allow me to get the machine, some of the fibers and fabrics, and mail your perks.  If I exceed my goal, I will be able to take off time from jewelry making to complete and deliver your perks sooner!


If i do not make my goal I do not get to keep any of the money, as without the machine I cannot create the perks!
 
(Since I will be trying to get this machine in any case, feel free to contact me through Facebook or Etsy about getting one of these perks made in the future.)
Why This Matters

Has there ever been something you always wished you could do? My graduating college with actual good grades is that to me.
In addition, as I said, I love making unique things, and this is about as unique as I can get!
You will be supporting an individual craftswoman, not a big business, who is making things by hand because she loves to, and who is supporting herself and her family through art, instead of spending the same money on "everyone has one" items made who knows where by no one knows who. Get something unique for your money!
I have a long track record of making things that people are happy with.  I have always stood by my products, and most of my business is from repeat customers.


Other Ways You Can Help

I went back to college, so I understand that not everyone has the same kind of money. Right now what money I have goes to books and pet food.  EVERYONE can help though.
Publicity is worth way more than people think.
If you can tell people about this project, you will make a difference!
Share this on Facebook, Tweet it, tell your family to "buy you a pin", or just tell your friends who you know like interesting stuff. It all helps!
And the more often people talk about this project the more likely someone is to decide they would really like that messanger bag...

story:
&FORLOVE is a new brand of contemporary bridal for the high style, chilled-out bride. Our non-traditional aesthetic exudes effortless glamour, edgy yet romantic sensibilities and fashion-forward silhouettes.

Our gowns range in style from modern simplicity for the downtown girl, distressed tulle skirts for the romantic punk, and flowy gypsy dresses for the bohemian bride. Accessories include silk headscarves with Swarovski crystals, headbands with caviar beading and embellished cuffs.

To see images of our products available on Indiegogo, click on the 'gallery' tab above. And find more images on our Pinterest page http://pinterest.com/andforlove/forlove-contemporary-bridal/ 

Campaign

The money raised here will go towards producing our 2013 marketing campaign for our debut collection. The campaign consists of a short fashion video, lookbook, and product photos for our website. These will be used as tools to help us communicate with our customers from around the world. 

The Impact of Your Support

We believe in creative collaborations. We feel it's only fair to give back to the people who are generously supporting us and giving their time to make this campaign a reality. 

Our goal is to raise $16,000 to cover the cost of equipment rentals and post production processing, but most of all we want to offer fair compensation to the creative people behind the scenes and infront of the camera.

Offering

Perk 1: $20, Name a Dress. At the end of this campaign, we will randomly draw a name from the entries to become the style name of a dress from our 2013 collection. The dress you name could become a best seller and go on to sell for years to come!

Perk 2: $100, Producer Credit. Your name will be credited on our website as a producer of our campaign film. And you can enter to name a dress (+Perk 1).

Perk 3: $236, Dalia Belt. Silk ribbon belt embellished with lace and Swarovski crystals and caviar beading. Colour: vintage white. Size: one size. (+Perk 1 and 2). 

Perk 4: $326, Georgette Headscarf. Delicate 100% silk georgette headscarf with hand-stitched hem. Colour: natural white. Size: one size. (+Perk 1 and 2). 

Perk 5: $1200, Indiego Dress. No joke, we named this dress 'Indigo' before deciding to add it to the list of perks; but in honour of this process, we have renamed the dress 'Indiego'. Made with 100% silk. This flowy strapless dress is comfortable and easy to dress up with accessories. Features: elastic top and waist, and full length lining. Colour: natural white. Size: see the size chart below to find the size that best fits your measurements. (+Perk 1 and 2).

Perk 6: $1400, Indiego Dress + Dalia Belt. The Dahlia belt is a perfect match for the Indiego dress. Simply special! (+Perk 1 and 2).

Perk 7: $1680, Indiego Dress + Dalia Belt + Georgette Headscarf. This trio makes a beautiful ensemble for your special day. (+Perk 1 and 2).

Perk images: see images of these perks in the gallery (click the 'gallery' tab at the top of this page) and on our Pinterest page http://pinterest.com/andforlove/forlove-contemporary-bridal/ 

Size Chart*: (Please specify which size you want when ordering your perk)

  • Size 0 = 32" bust, 25" waist, 35" hips
  • Size 1 = 33" bust, 26" waist, 36" hips
  • Size 2 = 34" bust, 27" waist, 37" hips
  • Size 3 = 36" bust, 29" waist, 39" hips
  • Size 4 = 38" bust, 31" waist, 41" hips
  • Size 5 = 40" bust, 33" waist, 43" hips

Dress length for all sizes is 47" from waist to floor. 

*See the measurement guide image (click 'gallery' tab at top of page).

Note: We do not offer custom sizing or alterations. 

We are officially launching our collection online in mid-July, so you'll be ahead of the curve if you buy an item here! Every item is made-to-order in downtown Toronto, Canada.

Shipping + Delivery Time

Perks will be ready to ship by July 8th, 2013.

For delivery within Canada/US:

  • Add $60 to your contribution for shipping charges.
  • Please allow 2-3 weeks shipping time.

For International delivery:

  • Add $120 to your contribution for shipping charges.
  • Please allow 4-6 weeks shipping time.

Note: Due to the delicate made-to-order nature of our dresses we do not offer returns.

About Us

&FORLOVE was co-founded in October 2012 by designers Angel Spendlove and Julie Forand. The duo met while completing their undergraduate degrees at OCAD University and bonded over their mutual love of style and fashion. 

Spendlove is a former professional ballerina and has performed with ballet companies around the world, including English National Ballet and Birmingham Royal Ballet, and now performs seasonally with Toronto’s Opera Atelier. Forand studied at the Art Institute of Vancouver and later at OCAD U for Industrial Design.  

Thank You!

Help us spread the word too. Share our Indiegogo campaign with people by using the Indiegogo share tools! The more people see our Indiegogo campaign, the more successful it will be.

We truly appreciate your support.

LOVE,
Angel & Julie xoxo

 

Contact Info

info@andforlove.com

www.andforlove.com

 

Follow us on:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ANDFORLOVE 

Twitter: @and_for_love 

Pinterest: http://pinterest.com/andforlove/forlove-contemporary-bridal/ 

Instagram: http://instagram.com/andforlove

story:
We are 2 grads of the University of Washington Architecture department.  REdesign Studios is our commitment to responsible design in every way.  We believe you don’t have to compromise good design for sustainable design.  We started as custom furniture designers, have worked on several architectural projects, and are currently focused on our line of REcycled wood bike fenders.

     Your contribution will help us expand the reach of our REcycle Wood Fender Series.  Our ultimate goal is to replace every plastic fender with our beautiful wood fenders.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $5000 to help us boost production, fill bigger orders, and get our fenders into more markets.  

 

 

For your contribution we have put together some one-of-a-kind gifts.  

We are designers and woodworkers....  so we designed a wood sticker for those who can contribute at the 25$ level.

 

If you can donate $50 you can pick from one of the following t-shirt designs.

     For the $100 level we will send you a limited edition set of fenders made as our thank you to our Indigogo contributors.  

 

     If you want something special the $1000 donation will get you a personalized set of fenders with whatever you'd like laser etched onto the top of the fender.  

 

What your contribution does.

     Right now we are a small shop.  Your contribution will give us the ability to compete with the big boys out there... and help us bring clean responsible design to everyone who loves their bike.  

     Even if you cant donate... please share this video with everyone and anyone.  Tweet it...Facebook it... Pin it... or do whatever you can.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone and welcome to Women, Sports, Heels, need I say more.....My name is Christina and I started a small business called Christinas Custom Heels, you can google it to see more pics

I am a woman who once loved to walk around in heels, I am a girly girl. I had cancer in 2006 and had a tumor removed from my right pelvic bone. After removing the tumor and my right pelvic bone doctors told me i was paralized in my right leg and would never walk again. 

But that did not stop me from wearing heels. I love heels and football so much that i wanted to make a pair of heels for myself to show my team spirit. And I did. Alot of women see my heels and want them. I do not have the money to keep up with orders and i really need a place where I can open up shop. I need help doing something that noone else has done before and thats tap into this world of sports and heels

If you help me reach my goal I can make my dreams come true and get a place for rent and open up shop and have heels to sale

What We Need & What You Get

I need a place to call my work office. Right now i work from home and i have no room. I need a place where customers can come and shop around. I would love to start off with 75 to 100 pair of heels that range about $40 each. 

I use crystals and lots of paint and pain brushes for my designs cause everything is done by hand. 

I do offer free shirts with my company logo on it as a thank you gift ad i will pick one lucky person who funds a free pair of heels for the person of their choice wih any team of their choice.

The Impact

By helping me start my own company you will also help others cause i will have funds to employ other women with similar talent to help me. Women all over the world love to wear heels and its sexy....and men, its even sexier when your woman loves sports, so why not combine the two. I have the fan base, please look me up on Facbook, I have over 10,000 fans who all want my heels i just need the start up money to do this please.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

When you find your favorite pair of sunglasses, the ones that fit juuust right...The ones you never want to replace! Avenue Lou was born because replacing or losing your favorite pair of sunglasses is the worst! 

We wanted to create a sunglass case that was durable, well designed and well made using materials that would keep your favorite pair of sunglasses safe and sound....Forever. So we came up with the greatest Sunglass Case ever known to mankind!

 

Premium Materials

When we set out to make our Lou's we wanted the best materials protecting your favorite sun sun's, so we went to work!

We found that a strong iron case would offer the best protection for that precious pair. 

We wanted the material covering the case to be durable and long lasting so we found a leather calf skin that was perfect. The inside boasts a smooth suede-like material that will keep your shades lasting into the end of time and beyond.

Our Plan

The funds raised through our Indiegogo project will be used to make our Avenue Lou Sunglass Case line, which includes 6 different designs. The funds will help with the costs associated with a large scale production run.

Limited Edition - Each of our collections will be limited editions. Once we run through the collection a new one will be introduced. We would like to have a total of 12 designs in each collection. This is where we need your help!

Stretch Goal - If we reach $15,000 we will be able to make 6 other designs to add to our collection. This process will be crowd sourced. In other words, we will have a group of possible designs and YOU will get to decide what we produce to make the collection complete, plus some nice incentives for your help! (Don’t worry GUYS, we know you have favorite shades too, we will work on getting some designs for men as well.)

Case Size 

When we set out to make the greatest sunglass case ever, we wanted the size to fit over-sized sunglasses. Our case dimensions are 3” Wide x 2.5” High  x 6.5” Long. We really want to make an even bigger case for those really over-sized puppies. So if…

Stretch Goal - If we get to $10,000 we will be able to include a case with the following dimensions  3.5” Wide x 3” High x 6.5” Long. This will be able to handle any sunglasses in the world.  Help us make that happen!!

REASONS TO SUPPORT LOU

  • Using a Lou makes your shades look even better than they already do.   
  • A Lou is easy to find in your bag or purse.
  • Your friends and paparrazo won’t get enough of you.
  • Since they can’t get enough of you, you can get them their own Lou, now they will want even more of you.
  • Get them for your wife, girlfriend, BFF, boo, besties, mom, mother-in-law (good call), bridesmaids  neighbors, boss (ah yeeeah), perfect gift of all time. And don’t forget to get one for yourself.
  • Hey, don’t limit your Lou just for shades. Gum, lipstick, straight up cash and cards will fit with your shades when you hit the beach (no need for a big bag).
  • It's so versatile, use your imagination to decide how you'll use it!

Lou says your sunnies are begging you to get them a case! Thanks for your support! 

Why We Need Your Help   

Lou has been going to great lengths to make the best sunglass case ever known to man kind.

The challenge of our campaign is spreading the message that we make the greatest Sunglass Case ever. (Have we mentioned that?) With so many amazing projects out there, it is going to be tough to get the attention we need to make this Indiegogo successful. To get to as many people as possible, we are reaching out to friends, families, and various blogs to help us spread the word. We need as much help as possible

Once the funding is in place, our challenge is making sure production stays on schedule, and making sure there is capacity to make large quantities of Lou's. We want to ensure quality standards and are going to great lengths to deliver our cases quickly and promptly. We feel that with our established partners we will be able to produce and maintain production in an efficient manner and get Lou's out to the world! We are confidant that once the campaign ends we will be able to get cases SENT OUT before the end of June!

The funds raised through our Indiegogo project will be used to make our Avenue Lou Sunglass Case line, which includes 6 different designs. The funds will help with the costs associated with a large scale production run.
Limited Edition - Each of our collections will be limited editions. Once we run through the collection a new one will be introduced. We would like to have a total of 12 designs in each collection. This is where we need your help!
Stretch Goal - If we reach $15,000 we will be able to make 6 other designs to add to our collection. This process will be crowd sourced. In other words, we will have a group of possible designs and YOU will get to decide what we produce to make the collection complete, plus some nice incentives for your help! (Don’t worry GUYS, we know you have favorite shades too, we will work on getting some designs for men as well.)










Case Size 
When we set out to make the greatest sunglass case ever, we wanted the size to fit over-sized sunglasses. Our case dimensions are 3” Wide x 2.5” High  x 6.5” Long. We really want to make an even bigger case for those really over-sized puppies. So if…
Stretch Goal - If we get to $10,000 we will be able to include a case with the following dimensions  3.5” Wide x 3” High x 6.5” Long. This will be able to handle any sunglasses in the world.  Help us make that happen!!


REASONS TO SUPPORT LOU

Using a Lou makes your shades look even better than they already do.   
A Lou is easy to find in your bag or purse.
Your friends and paparrazo won’t get enough of you.
Since they can’t get enough of you, you can get them their own Lou, now they will want even more of you.
Get them for your wife, girlfriend, BFF, boo, besties, mom, mother-in-law (good call), bridesmaids  neighbors, boss (ah yeeeah), perfect gift of all time. And don’t forget to get one for yourself.
Hey, don’t limit your Lou just for shades. Gum, lipstick, straight up cash and cards will fit with your shades when you hit the beach (no need for a big bag).
It's so versatile, use your imagination to decide how you'll use it!



Lou says your sunnies are begging you to get them a case! Thanks for your support! 


Why We Need Your Help   
Lou has been going to great lengths to make the best sunglass case ever known to man kind.
The challenge of our campaign is spreading the message that we make the greatest Sunglass Case ever. (Have we mentioned that?) With so many amazing projects out there, it is going to be tough to get the attention we need to make this Indiegogo successful. To get to as many people as possible, we are reaching out to friends, families, and various blogs to help us spread the word. We need as much help as possible
Once the funding is in place, our challenge is making sure production stays on schedule, and making sure there is capacity to make large quantities of Lou's. We want to ensure quality standards and are going to great lengths to deliver our cases quickly and promptly. We feel that with our established partners we will be able to produce and maintain production in an efficient manner and get Lou's out to the world! We are confidant that once the campaign ends we will be able to get cases SENT OUT before the end of June!

story:
Blind and visually impaired represent 314 mln group of people around the world. They have limited perception of the world, which often does not allow them to conduct a regular life.

Existing Smart Glasses are expensive, cumbersome to use, but most of all are not adapted to blind’s need.

Parsee is addressed to people with vision disability who have access to mobile network and possess a smartphone. With our solution they will explore the world as sighted people perceive it. Parsee provide full mobility, can be used freely anywhere and anytime. 



From the moment we have started developing Parsee, our vision was to make a solution which helps millions to live normally. Blind and visually impaired people with Parsee glasses can read any printed text. Our revolutionary eyewear recognize shapes, colors, faces of loved ones and friends.


An IP camera connected to simple 3D printed frame comunicates with a mobile device where our mobile app identifies text, colour, shape or face which will output in sound to earphones attached to frame.

  • Conectivity – mobile app creates a hot spot, which Parsee uses to send a photo stream from glasses and sound from smartphone.
  • Rechargable battery – in frame we put long life battery, which you can charge through micro USB.


                                 

                    Text Recognition                                                            Face Recognition

                                          


             Shapes & Items Recognition                                            Color Recognition




  • Patent pending
  • Working prototype
  • Preparations for further R&D – fundraising, consultations with engineers.




Even though we have big ambitions, we are a non – profit organization, with limited resources and capacity. The largest possible number of people using Parsee solution – for free! This is our vision.

For the last year we have been working on prototype, basing on our savings, time and efforts in developing Parsee. Now we are close to important milestone: improvement of our prototype and getting ready to support this ones, who need it the most.

This is were you come in. With help from you, we plan to make Parsee technologically ready to start production. 


Our team is based on experienced, motivated and highly involved people. Participation in this project is a challange and huge adventure.


  

Marcin Łapa
Project leader, successfully completed many new-tech projects. From e-commerce implementation to bio-tech and mobile solutions as well s Big Data and IoT. He managed all those initiatives. 

Jarosław Żak
Strategic management enthusiast, experienced manager, PhD candidate at Warsaw School of Economics. Passionate of metal music and fishing.

Radosław Zajączkowski
Over 10 years experience in IT - desktop, web, mobile, cloud; software architect / developer in projects completed and delivered for the global market


Sebastian Mazur
Java software developer by profession and passion. From very beginning associated with the Android platform and other mobile solutions. Fascinated by new technologies and unconventional solutions. 


Bartosz Trzciński

Communicative Sales and Project manager. Enthusiast of new technologies,  basketball and music.

Dawid Marciniak
Biomedical engineer, 3d modeling and printing parts expert. Interested in medicine, fishing and 3d printing.


Daniel Dmitrzak
Passionate about electronics and technology. Currently studying at the AGH University of Science and Technology in Cracow, Poland.  He always wanted to use his abilities to help others and the Parsee project has given him the perfect opportunity to do so.


Marek Sedrowicz
Student at University of Science and Technology in Warsaw. In Parsee project he is responsible for design of our Glasses.


SEEN ON:

story:
Nitsua Tribe was established in 2019 with a sole purpose: to help empower residents in Nicaragua by establishing a label that utilizes their skills while helping them help themselves.

ABOUT NITSUA TRIBE

Why Nicaragua? Mayling Krueger is the owner and innovator behind Nitsua Tribe and has a strong connection to the country as her parents hail from Nicaragua. She has been told stories of this country her entire life and has seen first hand the level of poverty increase in rural areas when she went down this past spring break.

Frustrated with the lack of progress in the country, Mayling wanted to do something to give back and help empower people who are otherwise left without work.

By teaming up with local artisans, purchasing materials locally, and creating beautifully handcrafted items, Nitsua Tribe was born.

People come back to Nitsua Tribe because they know that when you purchase one of our pieces you are not just buying an item, you are helping change someone’s life.

All of our products are handmade by native Nicaraguan artisans. Every time you buy Nitsua Tribe, you are creating jobs, feeding, and educating kids as a portion of all proceeds go back into the community. You are changing someone’s life.

Help this vision. Join our mission. Join our Tribe.

PRODUCT DESCRIPTIONS

An eclectic mix of minimalistic, bohemian, and glamour. Nitsua Tribe is known for its effortless look. Every piece is banging. We like to think of ourselves as trend setters.

MAYA

Pictures don’t do it justice, you have to hold it in your hands to understand the true beauty of this piece. This clutch-style wallet offers ample room for cards and currency with an interior zip. Not only will you never need another wallet again, because our artisans are insanely talented but this purchase will help provide kids with school supplies. Now that’s pretty rad and deserves a high five!

BEKA

This purse gets you your bang for your buck. Cute mini purse by day, sexy sleek clutch by night. This piece offers the versatility of being a convertible by having removable straps. Nevermind that this beauty is a super trendy convertible, let’s focus on what is most important. You just fed 30 impoverished kids! Now, that my friend is pretty cool.

RAINE

Minimalism is our jam, yet still sophisticated with sleek, slender straps perfect for the busy working babe. This bag features a magnetic-snap tab closure, zipper wall inside, smartphone pockets and a soft leather divider for your electronics. Not only are you helping create fair paying jobs to Nicaraguan artisans and helping families support themselves, but this purchase also helps sponsor a child’s education. Today is a good day friend!

KAINE

Talk about on point with this trendy round cross body. This bad boy offers adjustable straps, top zip closure, exterior slip pocket, interior zip wall, and smartphone pockets inside. This bad boy is not only for the trendy babe, but the babe with the heart of gold. This purchase helps a family continue providing for their loved ones, and also feeds impoverished kids, 50 to be exact!

FAITH

This cross body has a minimalistic vibe, perfect for the boho beauty. This bag offers a top-zip closure, a zipper wall inside with two smartphone pockets. What you’ll love about this purse, even more than its good looks, is that every time you look down at this it is a reminder that YOU helped keep kids in school in a developing country. This purchase translates into school supplies for one classroom.

ISABELLA

These boots speak for themselves. Handmade with leather soles. We have had tremendous interest in this item, so hurry before they are all gone! These beautiful boots are not only super stylish, but are helping to provide fair pay jobs AND it doesn’t stop there, they are also helping keep kids in school!

TARA

These shoes are not only hand made to perfection with leather soles, but they will go with anything outfit! You just helped fight poverty. Look at you go! You created fair pay work for a very deserving and talented artisan who can now support his family. Amazing! You also just helped end the generational cycle of poverty through education AND spiritual growth. Money from this item goes towards a child’s education. AND you get a pair of sweet shoes, win win!

WILLIAM

These shoes take the stress out of trying to pair them with an outfit, this look goes perfectly with dresses, skirts or pants. Not your ordinary pair of cute ‘must have’ shoes, no sir! These bad boys are helping a child stay in school, now that my friends is something you can pat yourself on the back for. Or, we will just give you a cyber pat!!

$2500 DESIGN YOUR OWN PERK

Being a small, independent, artisan manufacturer means that Nitsua Tribe can make your dreams come true! Your custom creation will be hand-crafted with one of our insanely talented Nicaraguan artisans.

This purchase is the big kahuna, the big fish, the whole 9-yards! Money from this pledge will result in you sponsoring a whole classroom. We are talking an ENTIRE classroom with supplies, uniforms, and even meals. Holy crap, YOU just did that. Your generosity will go a long, long, way.

*All items are handmade, therefore they may have small imperfections, or there might be slight variations of colour and design of each product. There may be natural blemishes/variations that are not product flaws. Such variations are inherent in the manufacturing of handmade products, so you may find minor distinctions that make your Nitsua Tribe purchase special and truly one-of-a-kind.

*All sales are final. Since each purchase benefits the artisans and organizations receiving profits, we are unable to issue refunds. If your purchase does not work for you, please consider gifting or selling your item to a friend or family member. You are contributing to a great cause, give yourself credit for this good deed!

story:
At Bondi Swim Co, we live for summer, and to have the perfect summer you need the perfect summer swim-shorts! The problem is most swim-shorts just don't tick all the boxes. 

Swim-shorts; they're either too long, too short, too wide, or too tight. They compromise on either function, comfort or style, and to make it worse you have to change them all the time. 

We know this swim-short problem has needed fixing for years, so over the past 18 months we have been working non-stop on designing the ultimate pair of swim shorts, that you will be able to live in all summer long.

 

Every pair of Bondi Swim Co Swim-shorts features our bold signature ribbon design, so you can transform these shorts from a high performance swim-short into a tailored summer short. Simply fold up the cuff to change the look, length and style of these shorts into a designer short. Now you have a swim-short that you can wear all day, and go straight from the beach to the beach bar or wherever your day takes you. 

 

The perfect swim-shorts need the perfect fabric and we spent months and months working with our manufacturers to engineer the ultimate swim-short fabric. Our specially designed premium fabric is a unique polyester microfibre which features stretch performance technology and with durability for long lasting use.

With the increased flexibility in these swim-shorts you will feel comfortable all day, and your movement will never be restricted. Whether you like swimming, running, partying or just relaxing these all day swim-shorts have you covered.

 

Our customised premium fabric is also infused with water resistant hydrophobic technology, so water and liquids will bounce off these shorts keeping them dry unless fully submerged. The quick drying properties in these swim-shorts will have you dry in the fastest possible time, so you will never need to worry about taking a second pair of shorts with you to the beach. They are designed to drip dry as quick as possible so you can head straight from the beach to the beach bar, or wherever your day takes you.

 

These swim-shorts feature a specially built in hidden zip pocket on the side, to give you the perfect place to store your keys and phone, so you can keep your valuables safe and secure. Our 5 pocket design swim-short also features two foldable back pockets for extra storage, so you will be prepared for anything, wherever your day takes you.

 

These swim shorts have the style of a classic European tailored short, designed to look great in every occasion. They are also the perfect length, sitting just above the knee, to make sure that your movement is never restricted. For a shorter length, simply fold up the cuff, which will shorten the length of these swim-shorts to that of a designer short. 

The wrinkle free properties embedded in this fabric will ensure that these shorts will remain crease-free, and always look great in and out of the water.

 

 

 

 

NEW COLOUR UNLOCKED - BLACK

 

 

Bondi Swim Co bases all its sizes on international standards. If you are usually a size Medium, then go for that size. If you are in-between sizes, we suggest selecting a larger size and then using the button tabs to adjust the short to the perfect fit. 

 

 

Designed in Sydney Australia, these shorts have been designed for all-day use to handle whatever your day demands. We spent 18 months on prototype development and extensive fabric testing, until we came up with the perfect swim-shorts we have always wanted. Our swim-shorts are styled with a classic European tailored cut, designed to look good in any situation.

 

 

When we started Bondi Swim Co 18 months ago, cost was a motivating factor. We wanted to make a premium quality swim-short at an affordable price point. The current retail margins, through avenues such as wholesaling and physical retail stores are very high, particularly when sourcing the best quality fabrics on the market. In a retail setting, our swim-shorts would cost over $200 in retail, but by being on Indiegogo, we are able to accomplish our goal of making the perfect premium swim-shorts at a great price.

 

With our suppliers and manufacturers firmly in place, we are confident we will be able to meet these timelines.

 

 

Please feel free to email us directly at team@bondiswim.co if you have any questions or concerns about our campaign

The Team @ Bondi Swim Co.

story:
1 bag, 2 different fabrics

1_ Embossed Leather bag

The embossed leather is particularly resistant to everyday snags. A high-quality full-grain leather that will face your daily moves without bumping. The embossed leather offers exceptional color rendition. Deep tones, which will have no variation over time. This slightly satiny leather is ideally matched with the black vegetal leather of handles and zip pullers.

 

2_ Vegetable tanned leather bag / Sac en cuir "végétal".

This leather has two strong interests. First, it reduces the impact on the environment by using natural materials in the waning process. Secondly, this leather will become more and more beautiful with skate over the time

 

The perfect storage for 2 days and 1 night travel

 

Dressing compartment
 
Office Compartment

 

3 different colors

 

1. Black Embossed Leather Bag

 

2. Black and Cognac Vegetable-Tanned Leather

 

3. Full Cognac Vegetable-Tanned Leather

 

The perfect Toiletry bag

In addition to our 36 Hour Travel Bag, we designed a toiletry bag that perfectly fits with our bag's size. This toiletry bag is declined in 3 color versions.

 

 

Black Toiletry Bag

 

Black and Cognac Toiletry Bag

Full Cognac Toiletry Bag

 

We already have a strong partnership with our factory, which guarantees that our products will be manufactured in time and with a high quality construction. With your help, we want to develop LUNDI's products and distribute our collection in beautiful stores all over the world.
